description: Goody Products, Kearny, N.J., a maker of plastic personal-care products available at the 80,000 or so drug and discount stores around the country, has retained Waring & LaRosa to look after its first major consumer ad campaign.

title: Westbeth at 20: Artists' Utopia Still A-Borning
description: In 1969 when construction began, Westbeth in Greenwich Village was hailed as a place where poets, painters and performers would find low rents, large rooms and sympathetic neighbors.

title: New Weapons Are Sought to Battle Lyme Disease in Most Severe Cases
description: Physicians and medical researchers are striving for new precision in treating people who do not recover quickly from Lyme disease, either because widely used drugs do not help them or because their illness was undiagnosed and untreated for too long.

title: Keeping Hot Potatoes Out of the Political Kitchen
description: They've rewritten Harry S. Truman's old maxim, or so it sometimes seems these days. Even if you can't stand the heat, contemporary political wisdom maintains, you don't have to get out of the kitchen - you appoint a ''nonpolitical'' commission to do the sweating for you.

title: Donations for Memorial To Philip H. Dougherty
description: The Philip H. Dougherty Memorial Committee, an ad hoc advertising group, announced that it had received more than $50,000 in donations toward a memorial being established at Ithaca College in honor of the late advertising columnist of The New York Times.

title: Northwestern Public Service reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Allied Bankshares Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Care and Cleaning Of Venetian Blinds
description: ''YOU ought to see how long people wait to bring in their Venetian blinds for cleaning,'' Louis Manganiello said. ''I've got to put gloves on to pick them up.''

title: Yields Post Weekly Gain
description: Yields for certificates of deposit, bank money market accounts and money market mutual funds rose for the week ended yesterday. The increases were slightly larger than those reported the previous week.

title: Continental Savings of Amerca reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Grossman's Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included extraordinary credits of $703,000 for the quarter and $2,006,000 for the year.

title: N.F.L. Teams Pare Rosters As Owners Impose Plan
description: The National Football League's new system of free agency, which went into effect yesterday, is like a boiling pot of stew. Each team tossed in its share of ingredients and this afternoon, when the lid is lifted, everyone will find out what the mix is.

title: Baker, Fentress & Co reports earnings for Year at Dec 31
description: Assets represent net assets. The company said the latest year share earnings are after a $1.40 long- term and an 18.6 cent short-term capital gain distribution paid in December 1988.

title: Report Finds Poverty Among Children Is Up
description: Poverty among white children has increased by almost a third during the 1980's, and nearly half of all black children and a third of all Hispanic children in the nation are poor, according to a report released Tuesday that called for spending $4.3 billion to help children.

title: Shamir Says His West Bank Plan Includes Pulling Out Some Troops
description: Prime Minister Yitzhak Shamir said today that an autonomy plan that he had proposed for the occupied West Bank and Gaza Strip would include the withdrawal of Israeli troops from densely populated Palestinian areas.

title: Madison Ave. Quits Madison Ave.
description: After six decades in which advertising has been indelibly associated with the East Side of Manhattan, ''Madison Avenue'' is moving west.

title: Drug Use Ruled a Cause in Plane Crash
description: The National Transportation Safety Board ruled today for the first time that illegal drug use had contributed to the crash of an American commercial airliner.

title: Fidelity National Financial Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
description: The company said the improved earnings in the fourth quarter reflect the successful assimilation of the former Western Title Insurance Co. operations, acquired at the end of fiscal 1987. Fiscal 1988 results costs associated with the integration of the acquired operations and relocation of corporate headquarters.

title: A Record-Breaker
description: When John O. Marsh Jr. walks into his office in the Pentagon this morning, he will become the longest-serving Secretary of the Army or Secretary of War, as the position was called until the Defense Department was set up in 1947.

title: Occidental Petroleum Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a loss of $11 million from debt extinguishment. c-After tax credits of $15 million for the quarter and $56 million for the year. The latest fourth quarter included a $45 million after-tax charge reflecting settlement with the U.S. Department of Energy on alleged violations of crude oil pricing controls. The year-ago fourth quarter included after-tax gains of $147 million, primarily from sale of stock in the company's IBP Inc. unit. The 1988 results benefitted from a $176 million gain on the issuance and sale of a 25 percent stock interest in the Occidental subsidiary owning the Colombian operations. The 1987 earnings benefitted from the receipt of a $100 million contingent payment in connection with the prior sale of a subsidiary owning one- half of Occidental's Colombian operations.

title: Pact for 24 Hollywood Craft Unions
description: In a contract settlement announced today, movie and television producers won major concessions from Hollywood's 24 craft unions, averting another costly strike in an industry plagued by work stoppages the last year.

title: U.S. Permits AIDS Patients to Use Unproven Drug
description: The first drug that is thought to prevent a deadly pneumonia in AIDS patients will be made available to seriously ill patients next week without formal Federal approval for marketing.

title: Nintendo Is Sued by Atari
description: The Atari Corporation has filed a $250 million lawsuit against the Nintendo Company, accusing the Japanese video game maker of monopolizing the market with restrictions on its licensed game creators.

title:
Currents;
On a Wall, Tricks For the Eye
description: LEAD: ARE you stuck in a standard-issue white-walled postwar apartment, but want prewar details? Anne Masacco, a designer, has come up with an answer: ''Instant Trompe L'Oeil,'' silk-screened wallpaper panels of mix-and-match classical trim.

title: Daniel Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss

title: Hiring Dispute Imperils Atlanta Stadium Effort
description: An opinion by the State Attorney General challenging the legality of a provision to assure the hiring of minority contractors has thrown a roadblock in front of plans to build a $210 million domed stadium.

title: Sawyer Leaving CBS For ABC
description: Diane Sawyer, a correspondent on ''60 Minutes,'' will leave CBS News after more than a decade to become a co-anchor of a new live prime-time news program on ABC. The move represents a coup for ABC, which already has in ''20/20'' a successful prime-time news program, and in Barbara Walters a correspondent who ranks in the same star category as Ms. Sawyer.

title: Genicom Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 1
description: b-Included gains from an accounting change of $4,300,000 for the latest year and $2,018,000 for the year-ago period.

title: Eagles Name Aide
description: Jeff Fisher, 31 years old, became the youngest defensive coordinator in the National Football League when he was promoted yesterday by Coach Buddy Ryan of the Philadelphia Eagles. Ryan also hired Tom Bettis, a veteran of 23 years in coaching, to replace Fisher, who for the last three years had been defensive-backfield coach. Fisher succeeded Wade Phillips, who quit to take a similar job with the Denver Broncos. Fisher, who had played with the Chicago Bears (1981-85) when Ryan was a defensive coach there, joined the Eagles when Ryan took over as coach in 1986. Bettis, 55, coached the Kansas City Chiefs' defensive backfield last season.(AP)

title: The Right Number of Americans
description: The very idea of a drop in national numbers always sets off alarms. In their book ''The Fear of Population Decline,'' Michael S. Teitelbaum and Jay M. Winter recall a 1979 essay, ''How a Nation Dies,'' written by a French Foreign Minister, no less, for a collection luridly titled ''Withered France.'' In 1982 Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn mourned that the Russian people ''has moved into a phase of biological degeneracy'' and before long would ''almost vanish from the face of the earth.''

title: Judge in North Case Angered by ABC News Report
description: Federal District Judge Gerhard A. Gesell today threatened to cite an ABC News reporter for contempt of court for broadcasting a television account about the trial of Oliver L. North that the judge said jeopardized the selection of an impartial jury.

title: Avoiding Heat On Pay Increase
description: The current dispute jover a pay raise for members of Congress is only the latest example of Washington's reliance on extra-constitutional mechanisms to protect elected officials from disapproving constituents. Scholars call it ''blame avoidance.''

title: Delmarva Power & Light Co reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Commodity Pool Regulations
description: The Securities and Exchange Commission and the Commodity Futures Trading Commission issued a joint request today for public comment on measures to standardize and improve the past performance data and fee tables in the prospectuses of public commodity pools.

title: TV Notes
description: Another Change at CBS

title: Beck Starts Title Defense
description: Chip Beck will defend his Nissan Los Angeles Open title starting Thursday at the Riviera Country Club in Pacific Palisades, Calif. The victory last year was the first in Beck's 10-year PGA Tour career.

title: Careplus Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included tax credits of $283,000 and $693,000 for the quarter and year, respectively. c-Net loss

title: Williams Scores 27 As Redmen Stop Slide
description: With time running out on their season and their hopes for a berth in the National Collegiate Athletic Association tournament, the St. John's Redmen made a statement last night.

title: First Amarillo Bancorp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a gain of $1,194,570 from debt extinguishment.

title: El Salvador Rebels Promise Not to Assault U.S. Envoys
description: Leftist rebels, citing a positive United States response to their peace proposal, said today that they would not attack American diplomats and civilians.

title: Fieldcrest Cannon Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss

title: Zurbriggen Injured
description: Pirmin Zurbriggen of Switzerland took a hard fall during downhill training yesterday at the world Alpine championships in Beaver Creek, Colo., but managed to ski off the mountain to be examined by team doctors and to have X-rays taken at Vail Valley Medical Center. Hugo Steinegger, a spokesman for the Swiss team, said Zurbriggern appeared to have a chest bruise. (AP)

title: Bush Backing Democrat for Post On Latin America in State Dept.
description: President Bush has tentatively selected a Democrat who supports the Nicaraguan guerrillas to supervise United States policy toward Latin America, State Department and White House officials said today.

title: National Bancshares Corp of Texas reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Preston Browne O'Sullivan, Banker, 86
description: Preston Browne O'Sullivan, a retired senior vice president of the Lincoln Savings Bank, died yesterday at Long Island College Hospital. He was 86 years old and lived in Brooklyn.

title: Ohio Congressman Is Focus of Inquiry Over Sex Allegations
description: A county prosecutor said today that Representative Donald Lukens has been under investigation by the Columbus police for three months on charges that Mr. Lukens had been sexually involved with a teen-age girl.

title: House-Building 101: A Hands-On Class
description: Joyce Cowfer was in tears when she called Pat Hennin to say she had miscalcuated the size of her foundation and realized it would cost $1,000 more to build her Maryland house.

title: Champion Products To Request Bids
description: The board of Champion Products Inc. said in a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission that it would request that all parties ''submit proposals with respect to an acquisition of the company at a date to be specified in the near future.'' Champion, which is holding a $244 million offer by a unit of Walsh, Greenwood & Company, said previously that it had been conducting preliminary negotiations with unidentified third parties, but it has not said how many parties besides Walsh, Greenwood may participate in the new bidding process.

title: Chrysler And Hyundai Plan Venture
description: The Chrysler Corporation and the Hyundai Motor Company of South Korea have reached a preliminary agreement under which Chrysler's 1,400 Jeep-Eagle dealers will begin selling a version of Hyundai's compact car, the Sonata, in 1991.

title: N. Carolina Is Upset By Clemson
description: Kirkland Howling hit a 3-point field goal and two free throws in the final 53 seconds as Clemson stunned No. 3 North Carolina in an Atlantic Coast Conference game tonight, 85-82.

title: Interstate Power Co reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The 1987 net included a writeoff of $2,952,000 for bad debt from customer bankruptcy, and power plant abandonment writeoffs.

title: BUSH BACKS PLAN TO ENHANCE ROLE OF SECURITY STAFF
description: President Bush has approved a revamping of the foreign policy machinery under which the White House national security adviser and his staff will be at the center of decision making, Administration officials said today.

title: Market Place; Small Investors Still Hesitating
description: WAITING for individual investors to return to the stock market is getting to be a little like waiting for Godot. Their arrival has been widely anticipated and hoped for since they fled in dismay after the crash of October 1987, but the return keeps getting delayed.

title: Knight-Ridder Profit Down
description: Knight-Ridder Inc. today reported an 8.8 percent decline in its fourth-quarter earnings, partly because of a one-time charge related to the costs of its joint newspaper operating agreement in Detroit.

title: Levi Strauss
description: Levi Strauss & Company said it would close a manufacturing plant in Elizabethton, Tenn., and permanently lay off all 140 employees. Levi Strauss said demand for unlined denim jackets, the product made at the plant, had slackened. ''Last year's sales of this product were below our projections,'' Peter L. Thigpen, a senior vice president, said. ''We are cutting our unlined denim jacket production in half to adjust to the declining market.''

title: House Panel to Hold Hearings on Ships' Anti-Missile System
description: A House committee today ordered hearings on the reliability of weapons designed to protect Navy frigates from cruise missiles after a Congressional report concluded that tests on the weapons were not realistic enough.

title: The Price of Reagan
description: The damage done to the country's institutions in the Reagan years will be a long time in the reckoning. But a drama that has just played out in Boston provides a telling example.

title: N.L.R.B. Awards $760,000 To 12 Ousted Union Waiters
description: After an unusual public contest, 12 waiters who were dismissed for trying to organize a union at a Chinese restaurant in Manhattan were awarded $760,000 in back pay yesterday.

title: Home & City Savings Bank reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Harry A. McArdle, Runner, 82
description: Harry A. McArdle, a lifelong running enthusiast who was the Metropolitan Amateur Athletic Union junior half-mile champion in the early 1930's, died after apparently suffering a heart attack while jogging near his home in Rego Park, Queens, on Jan. 23. He was 82 years old.

title: Review/Dance; A Rustic Romance With Swiss Precision
description: The Basel Ballet from Switzerland, which has rightly earned an international reputation under Heinz Spoerli, its director since 1973, made its Manhattan debut on Tuesday night with the American premiere of Mr. Spoerli's version of ''La Fille Mal Gardee.''

title: First Republic Bancorp Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
RESULTS PLUS
description: TENNIS Sabatini Advances: Gabriela Sabatini of Argentina struggled yesterday before beating an unheralded Japanese player, and Natalya Zvereva of the Soviet Union was upset in the Pan Pacific Open tournament in Tokyo. Sabatini, seeded 3d and ranked fourth in the world, beat 172d-ranked Akemi Nishiya, 6-3, 6-2, in 81 minutes. In another second-round match, Molly Van Nostrand of the United States, ranked 239th, upset Zvereva, ranked eighth, 6-2, 7-5. (AP) N.B.A. Suns 114, Lakers 97 Eddie Johnson scored 10 of his 32 points during a decisive 18-0 Phoenix run, and Los Angeles went scoreless for 6:57 in the second quarter at Phoenix. Magic Johnson led the Lakers with 17 points, but only had 1 in the fourth period. (AP) Celtics 107, Hornets 94: Robert Parish scored 24 points and grabbed 13 of his season-high 24 rebounds in the first quarter last night as Boston won in Charlotte, N.C. (AP) 76ers 114, Bullets 110: Mike Gminski scored 6 of 26 points in overtime to lift Philadelphia at home. Two backups-turned-starters, Shelton Jones and Scott Brooks, also sparked the 76ers. Jones had 20 points and Brooks had 18, career highs for both. Washington's Bernard King scored 35 points for his third consecutive 30-plus game. King scored the final 10 points of the fourth quarter for the Bullets, helping them rally from a 103-96 deficit to a 106-106 tie with 40 seconds remaining. King's two free throws sent the game into overtime. In the extra period, Gminski gave Philadelphia a 108-106 lead with a pair of free throws, but Steve Colter matched those, and the score was deadlocked at 108-108 with 4:34 to go. Gminski put the Sixers ahead, 110-108, with two more free throws but Jeff Malone, who scored 22 points for Washington, tied it again with 2:35 left. Gminski then scored at with 1:26 to go to give Philadelphia the lead for good after Washington lost the ball on a 24-second violation.(AP) N.H.L. Blackhawks 7, Jets 4Adam Creighton capped a furious four-goal assault in the first 7 minutes 57 seconds of the final period as Chicago rallied from a 4-0 first-period deficit at home. During the comeback, Chicago scored three times in 1:54, as Steve Konroyd got two goals. His second tied the score at 4-4. (AP) North Stars 4, Bruins 4Cam Neely's second goal of the game with 6 minutes 5 seconds remaining in the third period gave the Bruins the tie at Bloomington, Minn. Minnesota's Dino Ciccarelli extended his scoring streak to nine games when he opened the scoring with a power-play goal at 4:38 of the first period. Minnesota is 2-0-3 in its last five games, including three consecutive 4-4 ties. The North Stars are 6-5-6 in their last 17 games and lead the league with 13 ties. (AP) COLLEGE BASKETBALL/WOMEN Auburn 97, Fort Valley State 42: Linda Godby scored 22 points to lead five players in double figures last night as top-ranked and undefeated Auburn, playing at home, won its 20th consecutive game. The Lady Tigers are off to their best start ever and have equaled the Auburn mark for consecutive victories. Fort Valley State, a Division II school, dropped to 6-9. Auburn made 60 percent of its field-goal attempts in the first half and led, 52-25, at halftime.(AP) Maryland 84, Rutgers 71: Vicky Bullett and Deanna Tate led sixth-ranked Maryland with 22 points in College Park, Md. The Lady Terrapins improved to 16-2; the Lady Knights fell to 12-5. Telicher Austin led Rutgers with 19 points, Janet Malouf had 16 and LaTonya Johnson added 13. (AP) Virginia 87, North Carolina 79: Dawn Staley, a freshman, scored 21 points to lead No. 13 Virginia to an Atlantic Coast Conference victory in Chapel Hill, N.C. The loss was the seventh straight for the Tar Heels, a school record. Virginia improved to 15-5 over all and 5-3 in the conference. North Carolina dropped to 9-12 and 1-6.(AP)

title: Investors Savings reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Plantronics Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included net from discontinued operations of $842,000 and $1,462,000 for the quarter and 6 months, respectively. c-Included net from discontinued operations of $978,000 and $1,570,000 for the quarter and year, respectively. d-Net income There were 26 weeks in the latest 6 months, compared with 27 weeks a year earlier.

title: 4 Rebels Accused in South Africa Refuse to Take Part in Their Trial
description: Four black guerrillas of the outlawed African National Congress, charged with treason and murder, declared today that they did not recognize the civilian courts and refused to take part in their trial.

title: Rangers Catch Up but Then Lose in Overtime
description: With the Capitals, there is nothing sure about a late lead, except perhaps a bet that they'll find a way to lose it. Indeed, they had made so little stand up lately on the ice one reasonably wondered how they managed to keep their heads up in the locker room afterward.

title: DS Bancor Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Cold War Brinks, Revisited
description: No final answers emerged from the recent Moscow conference of American and Soviet participants in the 1962 Cuban missile crisis. Yet ten, five or even three years ago, who would have thought such an encounter possible? The meeting bodes well for Mikhail Gorbachev's call to remove embarrassing blanks from Soviet history.

title: Padres Sign Clark To 2-Year Contract
description: Jack Clark, the first baseman traded by the Yankees to the San Diego Padres last October, signed a two-year contract yesterday. The new agreement replaces the final year of his $1.5 million contract. ''We had agreed to honor a two-year commitment that was made to Jack Clark prior to the trade,'' said Dick Freeman, the acting club president, in a statement Tuesday night. (AP)

title: Firstcorp Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income The company saidd the results of the latest periods reflect the restructuring of reserves, which involved the transfer of $26 million of capital to reserves or valuation allowances for possible loan losses. All of the valuation allowances were against properties located in the research triangle area of North Carolina.

title: FINANCE/NEW ISSUES;
description: The Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation, known as Freddie Mac, is offering to the public two issues of short-term notes totaling $1 billion with maturities of three and six months. The offerings are being made through Freddie Mac and an 18-member selling group. Both issues were priced at par.

title: Abdul-Jabbar Left Off All-Stars
description: In packed arenas across the country, the teams and the fans have been saying their good-byes to Kareem Abdul-Jabbar with gifts and tributes. With All-Star Games considered more symbolic than competitive, the Western Conference coaches could have paid the 41-year-old, 7-foot-2-inch Los Angeles Laker center an even greater honor had they selected him for the National Basketball Association All-Star Game.

title: Clark Equipment Co reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included losses from discontinued operations of $4,423,000 and $6,696,000 for the quarter and year, respectively, and tax credits of $1,976,000 for the quarter and $8,659,000 for the year. c-Net loss and included losses from discontinued operations of $1,908,000 and $1,911,000 for the quarter and year, respectively, and tax credits of $1,091,000 for the quarter and $2,314,000 for the year. The company said the latest fourth quarter included a $3.1 million reserve for bonds of certain American governments and a $2.1 million loss related to restructuring of Mexican investments.

title: Warning: Campaign Finance Laws Are Enforced; Approval Voting
description: To the Editor:

title: INSIDE
description: Quayle in Venezuela

title: Yugoslavs, Citing Disarray, Strive for Unity
description: ''At the moment, we are incapable of making historic decisions,'' said Stipe Suvar, President of the Communist Party's Politburo. ''All we do is grope in the dark.''

title: Theodore Marshall, 86, Chemical Engineer
description: Theodore Henry Marshall, a retired chemical engineer and retired brigadier general in the Army Reserve, died of heart failure Tuesday at his home in Island Park, L.I. He was 86 years old.

title: Grace, W R & Co reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included income from discontinued operations of $20,064,000 and $36,700,000 for the quarter and year, respectively, and the year also included a gain of $4,854,000 which represents the cumulative adjustment for the adoption of Financial Accounting Standard No. 96 ''Accounting for Income Taxes. c-After a loss of $8,885,000 for the quarter and income of $18,586,000 for the year both from discontinued operations, and tax credits of $5,671,000 and $12,553,000 for the quarter and year, respectively.

title: New York City Served the Public Interest in the Macklowe Case
description: To the Editor:

title: Fed Official's Budget View
description: A Federal Reserve governor, Robert Heller, called today for further progress in reducing the United States budget deficit, saying such a development would be ''very positive for the market.''

title: Eugene A. Staley, 82, An Economist, Is Dead
description: Dr. Eugene Alvah Staley, an educator and international economist, died of lymph cancer Tuesday at the Stanford University Hospital in Palo Alto, Calif. He was 82 years old and lived in Palo Alto.

title: Globex Plan Supported
description: The staff of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission officially recommended today that the agency approve Globex, a computerized trading system proposed by the Chicago Mercantile Exchange. It would allow its futures or options contracts to be traded away from the traditional trading pit.

title: Security Capital Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a $303,000 income from discontinued operations.

title: Family Support
description: To The Home Section:

title: Study Questions Value of Some Procedures in Physical Exams
description: Many of the routine procedures doctors use on healthy adults undergoing periodic physical examinations are virtually useless, according to an analysis of medical studies reported this week.

title: Marcos Condition Is Critical After an Operation in Hawaii
description: Former President Ferdinand Marcos of the Philippines was moved back to intensive care at St. Francis Medical Center early today and is again in critical condition, a hospital spokeswoman said.

title: Puritan-Bennett Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Charges Settled In Insider Case
description: A former junior analyst at Morgan Stanley & Company who was convicted of insider trading has agreed to settle civil charges with the Securities and Exchange Commission and to pay $127,585.

title: Zygo Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss

title: Laclede Gas Co reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Brady Would Prefer To Remain Offstage
description: For all his credentials - his long friendship with President Bush, his former days as a top Wall Street investment banker and his stint as a United States Senator - Nicholas F. Brady seems to be off to a rocky start as Secretary of the Treasury.

title: Panel Seeks Tougher Laws On Adoptions
description: Stricter laws governing private adoptions in New York State, including tougher criminal penalties and a confidential state registry, were recommended in a report issued yesterday by the grand jury that investigated how Joel B. Steinberg obtained the little girl he was convicted of killing.

title: U.S. Envoy Calls Afghan Coup Possible
description: The former chief American diplomat in Kabul spoke today of the possibility of a coup against the Afghan President by Communist hard-liners or guerrilla sympathizers in the Government as the deadline for the Soviet troop pullout nears.

title: Multimedia Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
IBP Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: IBP said its 1988 results are not comparable to 1987 due to a 200 perecent increase in net interest expense, the result of financings which occurred at the time of its public stock offering in October 1987, partially offset by lower federal income tax rates. The share earnings fo 1987 were calculated on a pro forma basis, assuming that IBP's public offering and related financial transactions all occurred prior to the beginning of 1987. IBP said its net earnings, both in 1988 and 1987, were reduced by a non- cash item of $11 million. This related to the required amortization of about $380 million paid by Occidental Petroleum in excess of IBP' book value when it acquired IBP in 1981.

title: Hearing Set on Boy, 11, With 411 Crack Vials
description: An 11-year-old boy went to school in the Bronx Tuesday carrying a paper bag filled with more than 400 crack vials, and the City Human Resources Administration filed a court petition yesterday to remove him from his parents' custody.

title: Goddard Industries reports earnings for Year to Oct 1
BMR Financial Group reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The latest periods earnings reflected the acquisition of Citizens Banks of Americus, Georgia, on Dec. 31, 1987. The year-ago fourth quarter included after-tax charges of $107,000 related to an initial public offering of stock that was cancelled.

title: USX Steel Profits Seen at $60 a Ton
description: The USX Corporation's chairman, David M. Roderick, said that the company had corrected problems in the steel division that had caused steel profits to fall below expectations last year. USX had predicted that its steel profits in 1988 would be about $60 a ton shipped. But the USS unit, the nation's largest steelmaker, achieved a profit of only about $40 a ton shipped. Mr. Roderick said the $60 level would be attained this year.

title: In Re: Columbia Pictures And Puttnam's Orphans
description: Although it is nearly a year and a half since David Puttnam abruptly left his job as chairman of Columbia Pictures, nearly a dozen of his movies are still locked behind the studio gates. Like orphans in a Hollywood melodrama, they wait, fatherless and forlorn.

title: Plight of Children With AIDS Inspires Gifts to the Neediest
description: The plight of children with AIDS has moved many people to respond to the 77th annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, which runs through the end of this month.

title: Ladispoli Journal; A Very Crowded Vestibule of the Western World
description: Over the last several weeks, a surge of Jewish emigrants from the Soviet Union has turned this seaside resort near Rome into an overcrowded hive of tension and despair.

title: Occidental Settlement
description: The Occidental Petroleum Company said today that it had agreed to pay $205 million in the next eight years to settle charges by the United States Department of Energy that the company had violated oil-price controls from 1979 until 1981.

title: VSB Bancorp Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a pre-tax gain of $517,000 from a real estate joint venture project. The per share figures for both periods were not applicable as the company completed its initial public offering on Oct. 27, 1988.

title: Report on Clayton
description: Mark Clayton, the Miami Dolphins' wide receiver, is described as a ''big user'' of cocaine in the Feb. 6 issue of Sports Illustrated by an admitted drug dealer. The player's agent, David Ware, said the article is ''entirely false, shameless yellow journalism.'' The magazine quotes state prosecutor's documents in which a former limousine driver who is charged with cocaine trafficking describes Clayton and the suspended Dolphin wide receiver, Mark Duper, as ''big users'' of cocaine. The article reports that Ricky Arroyo, the former driver, told the Dade County State Attorney's Office that he shared cocaine with the two players on ''two or three occasions'' starting in 1983, and gave Clayton ''four or five grams'' of cocaine before a game last season. Arroyo, 29 years old, who was arrested last March on charges of attempting to purchase more than $100,000 of cocaine, was a driver for Super Duper Limo, co-owned by Duper, who was suspended by the National Football League in December for violating the league's substance-abuse policy. (AP)

title: Opa-Locka Journal; Grimy Reality Invades Fantasyland
description: Moorish domes and minarets rise like a vision from the Arabian Nights from the smoky taverns and rundown thrift shops of this poor Miami suburb, an amusement park without the amusement.

title: First Federal Savings & Loan Assn of Wooster reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Shevardnadze Flies to Beijing to Prepare Summit
description: Foreign Minister Eduard A. Shevardnadze of the Soviet Union arrived here tonight, saying he was ''full of good expectations and great hopes'' for three days of discussions with China's top leaders.

title: Conference Is Planned On Retail Ad Strategies
description: The Retail Marketing Society will sponsor a special conference on retail advertising strategies on March 22. The conference, to be held at the New York Hilton, will include lunch-time remarks by Jerry Della Femina, the irrepressible chairman of Della Femina, McNamee WCRS, who will answer the question, ''Is retail advertising real advertising?''

title: Hedda Nussbaum, Hardly a Heroine . . . But You Can't Imagine
description: The Steinberg trial is over but the print and electronic media are still filled with images of battered women and children. Commentators, viewers and listeners everywhere are asking, ''Why didn't she?'' - why didn't she call the police, contact the authorities, seek help, leave, do something?

title: Review/Ballet; A Troupe With a Toe in Two States
description: A dance troupe with two homes, the Pennsylvania and Milwaukee Ballet, opened a week's engagement Tuesday night at the Kennedy Center. Under the artistic direction of Robert Weiss, who directed the Pennsylvania Ballet of Philadelphia when it merged with the Milwaukee in 1987, the new company regularly performs in both cities. It thereby hopes to attract larger audiences and to attain greater financial security.

title: National Sanitary Supply Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a gain of $830,000 from the cumulative effect of an accounting change. The company said the 1988 sales increase was due mainly to the acquisition of Century Papers Inc. during the third quarter.

title: Why Pollute the North Jury Pool?
description: Congress took a considered risk in the summer of 1987 when it forced Oliver North to testify about his role in the Iran-contra affair. The investigating committees could not compel his testimony without a promise that it would not be used against him at any subsequent criminal trial.

title: Sale of Grossman's Being Considered
description: Grossman's Inc., a hardware and building materials store chain, said it was considering selling all or part of the company. Grossman's made the disclosure after reporting a sharp drop in earnings in the fourth quarter, which it said reflected a housing slowdown in the Northeast and other factors. Grossman's share price jumped $1.50 today, to $7.625. Its rise of 24.5 percent was the sixth largest among over-the-counter issues.

title: Review/Jazz; Reflections of Miles Davis
description: Cindy Blackman's first set at the Blue Note on Monday night started with a violent eruption of sound that didn't die down until the end of the show. Ms. Blackman, a young drummer, hounds silence, going after it with all her limbs until it gives up under the weight of her drumming.

title: USBancorp reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss The company said 1988 provision for loan losses was $2,225,000, compared with $15,394,000 in 1987.

title: Kellogg Co reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
168 Were Slain in October, 36 More Than Year Before
description: A total of 168 people were murdered in New York City in October, 36 more than the same month the year before, according to official Police Department statistics made public yesterday.

title: Talking Deals; Dillard's Desire For Vendex Stake
description: EVER since foreign investors staked out the United States as a fertile area for their money, the managements of some American companies have feared that such investments could be a prelude to a takeover.

title: EIP Microwave Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a gain of $748,000 and a pretax charge of $1,050,000 from the writedown of certain assets associated with a realignment. c-Included a tax credit of $393,000.

title:
Currents;
Philadelphia Museum's Energetic Desk
description: LEAD: The Philadelphia Museum of Art has a new information and admission desk designed by the architecture firm of Venturi, Rauch and Scott Brown of Philadelphia. In the museum's west lobby, the kiosk condenses many of the architectural themes and motifs for which the iconoclastic firm has become famous.

title: Hedda Nussbaum, Hardly a Heroine . . .
description: At lunch one day with a group of women covering the Steinberg trial, a stalwart feminist announced that she, but for a lucky combination of circumstances, could have been Hedda Nussbaum. Although I had heard similar remarks before, and have heard them since, I was appalled. I find this particular anguished expression of feminine identification simplistic and alarming.

title: Philip Morris Picks Official
description: The Philip Morris Companies Tuesday appointed Ehud Houminer president and chief executive of its cigarette subsidiary, Philip Morris U.S.A.

title: QUAYLE IN CARACAS TO HAIL NEW CHIEF
description: On his first diplomatic mission abroad, Vice President Dan Quayle today joined other foreign dignitaries, including 22 heads of government, who will be attend the inauguration of Venezuela's new President on Thursday.

title: Employers Casualty reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After capital losses of $262,908 and $29,413 for the quarter and year, respectively. c-Included capital gains of $71 for the quarter and $1,576,149 for the year.

title: Sunshine Bid For Rexene Is Called Off
description: The Sunshine Mining Company and the Rexene Corporation said today that they had abandoned a one-month-old tentative agreement for Sunshine to buy Rexene for about $865 million.

title: Musician's Death at 74 Reveals He Was a Woman
description: Billy Tipton, a jazz musician, lived life as a man, appearing to have a wife and adopting three sons. But a secret was disclosed when he died: he was a woman.

title: Fansteel Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss

title: Brenco Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Chicago Merc Rules Reviewed
description: Concerned with the Government's investigation of possible trading abuses, the Chicago Mercantile Exchange is considering two major changes in trading procedures, commodities traders and lawyers said today.

title: Warning: Campaign Finance Laws Are Enforced; At-Large Seats
description: To the Editor:

title: The Polygraph Virus
description: From 1977 through 1987, from the time of Stansfield Turner through the heyday of William Casey, our C.I.A. was super-secretly proud of its network of Cuban agents in Havana and in Fidel Castro's embassies around the world.

title: Crafts Present and Past At 2 Gallery Shows
description: TWO exhibitions that opened in New York last week offer important insights into the field of modern craft. One show is concerned with what is happening now; the other gives glimpses of what was being done about a decade ago. The contrasts will be apparent to the visitor who sees both.

title: Washington Water Power Co reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Revenue increase is attributable to a long-term power sale to Puget Sound Power & Light Co. which provided a $21,136,000 increase in revenue during the year.

title: LPL Investment Group Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The latest periods' results included a gain equal to 22 cents a share on the sale of marketable securities. LPL's 1988 results included the full- year effect of Amphenol Corp., acquired June 2, 1987.

title: Conductus Appointment
description: John M. Rowell, a leading researcher in the field of superconductivity, was named the vice president of research and development Tuesday for Conductus Inc., a start-up company in Palo Alto, Calif., that is seeking to apply the new high-temperature superconductors to electronics.

title: Ryder Plans Unit Sales And Buyback of Stock
description: Ryder System Inc. said today that it planned to buy back up to 15 percent of its common stock and that it was exploring the sale of its Insurance Management Services division and other operations.

title: Boatmen's Bancshares reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income The latest periods included non- recurring merger charges of $41.4 million for the quarter and $47.2 million for the year.

title: Napa Valley Bancorp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The latest quarter's earnings included after-tax gains on the sales of land held for development of $148,000, compared with $358,000 for the year- ago period. The 1987 earnings reflected an accounting change.

title: Among the Fresh, A Dweeb Is at a Loss
description: THE first time a 12-year-old walks out the door for ''some cold, cold lampin','' parents know that something has changed. A teen-ager has arrived.

title: Critics Hope to Eliminate Testing Panel
description: The Board of Examiners, the testing agency that since 1898 has decided who can teach or become a principal in New York City's public schools, is itself being put to a test these days, fighting for its survival against a powerful array of educators and politicians who are pressing for its abolition.

title: Caring for the Elderly
description: To The Home Section:

title: Figgie International Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The latest period results reflect an accounting change to include finance and insurance subsidiaries on a consolidated basis.

title: REAGAN'S BUDGET CALLED TOO ROSY
description: The Congressional Budget Office reported today that if the policies proposed in President Ronald Reagan's last budget were followed to the letter, the Federal deficit would be $120 billion in the next fiscal year.

title: G.M. to Shut Its Plant Near Boston
description: The General Motors Corporation said today that it would indefinitely shut its assembly plant in Framingham, Mass., by Aug. 1, putting 2,100 employees out of work.

title: Bush Plans Meeting With Bankers
description: President Bush plans to meet with banking and savings industry representatives on Thursday to discuss the proposals for rescuing the savings and loan industry, the White House said today.

title: People's Savings Bank of Brockton reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Coachmen Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss

title: Elcotel Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $1,684,000 for the quarter and $2,237,000 for the 9 months. c-Net income and after losses from discontinued operations of $315,000 and $517,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. Year-ago results are restated to reflect discontinuation of operator service and pay phone ownership-operation businesses.

title: Polk Audio reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Vermont American Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Witco Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included income of $20,289,000, or 81 cents a share, from the cumulative effect of an accounting change. c-Included a writedown equa to 19 cents a share from the sale of the company's oil and gas properties.

title: 2 Doctors and 2 Nurses Reinstated at Hospital
description: Two doctors and two nurses who were relieved of their duties at the Metropolitan Hospital Center in Manhattan after complaints that a patient had been sexually assaulted were reinstated yesterday.

title: Hint of Spring Ushers in Groundhog
description: Everyone in the New York metropolitan area hit the number yesterday. It was sixty-seven, and the payoff was that many degrees of sunny and sublime weather.

title: Cal Rep Bancorp Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Delta Computer Moving
description: In a move that runs counter to the trend toward offshore assembly, a company that makes personal computers in East Asia has decided to move its operations to Akron. The Delta Computer Corporation, which will lease space once occupied by the B. F. Goodrich Company, said the move to the United States would help it to control quality and reduce shipping time. Eugene Taylor, the company president, said the three-year-old company's products were now made and assembled in Taiwan, Korea and Hong Kong. The company plans to market a soft disk drive with about 60 times the normal storage capacity of floppy disks now on the market.

title: Weitek Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Construction Spending Up In December
description: Construction spending rose 2.5 percent in December, ending the year on a strong note, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Big Slices of Authority For 2 Brady Assistants
description: Nicholas F. Brady is taking his own approach to organizing the upper echelons of the Treasury Department that he inherited from James A. Baker 3d.

title: The U.N. Today
description: Economic and Social Council

title: Grottoes and Parrots, All Just an Illusion
description: ''I OFTEN get carried away,'' Graham Rust admitted. He was referring to the 13 years (one week a month) he spent painting sumptuous wall and ceiling decorations for a staircase at Ragley Hall in Warwickshire, England, the home of the Marquess and Marchioness of Hertford. completed in 1983.

title: Corrections
description: A map caption yesterday with an article about West Paterson, N.J., misstated the community's previous name in some copies. West Paterson was originally a section of Little Falls, not Dundee Lake.

title:
Currents;
Showing Off a New Material
description: LEAD: ''THE TRAVELING TRAY,'' designed by the architects Karen van Lengen and Joel Sanders, deals with boardwalk behavior; if you use this tray with suspenders you can eat on the run without spilling your ice cream. While the tray is not on the market yet, it is on view in the exhibition ''From Table to Tablescape'' at the new Contract Design Center in San Francisco through March 17.

title: SAKHAROV'S WORDS DRAW SOVIET FIRE
description: An editorial in the Government newspaper Izvestia accused Andrei D. Sakharov today of ''political fantasy'' for a French newspaper interview in which he was quoted as casting doubt on Mikhail S. Gorbachev's political future.

title: No Main Candidate for Hobey Baker Award
description: College hockey's best player this season has yet to jump out of the crowd and grab the attention of the selection committee for the Hobey Baker Award.

title: Citizens Savings Bank of New York reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After tax credits of $1,305,000.

title: Arnold Whitridge, Ex-Professor at Yale And an Author, 97
description: Arnold Whitridge, a former history professor at Yale University who was the author of many books, died Sunday at the Noble Horizon Home in Salisbury, Conn. He was 97 years old and lived in Salisbury.

title: Revamped Crazy Eddie Gets Change at the Top
description: Elias Zinn, president and chief executive of Crazy Eddie Inc., is relinquishing his job and returning to Houston to resume full-time management of the company he founded, Entertainment Marketing Inc., confident that the electronics discounter has turned a corner.

title: Top-Selling Books of 1988: Spy Novel and Physics
description: Tom Clancy's ''Cardinal of the Kremlin,'' a novel about a member of the Central Intelligence Agency who races to rescue an American mole in the Soviet Union, was the biggest selling hard-cover book in the United States last year, according to a survey by The New York Times. It was published last July and has 1,277,611 copies in print.

title: NEWS SUMMARY
description: International A3-15

title: Excelan Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Beneficial Goes After Banks
description: With new spots by Levine, Huntley, Schmidt & Beaver, the Beneficial Corporation, which once advertised its consumer lending services with the happy musical slogan, ''At Beneficial (toot-toot) you're good for more,'' has begun a frontal assault on the banking industry.

title: Commodore Fills Job Left Vacant Since '87
description: After reporting strong quarterly earnings this week, Commodore International Ltd. announced yesterday that it had named Mehdi Ali, a managing director at Dillon, Read & Company, as its new president.

title: Financial Corp. Filing
description: The Financial Corporation of America said today that it plans to convert its Federal bankruptcy filing from a Chapter 11 reorganization to a Chapter 7 liquidation.

title: Goldin Threatens to Sue Koch on Coliseum Plan
description: Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin contended yesterday that the Koch administration violated the City Charter in striking a new deal to develop the Coliseum site and added, through a spokesman, that he might sue Mayor Edward I. Koch to undo the settlement.

title: Inco Ltd reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: 1988 included a tax credit of $44.6 million. Inco said 1988 full-year results also included a $9.2 million writedown as a result of a physical inventory of scrap metals. Costs associated with employment reductions totaled $4.7 million in 1988 and $8.2 million in 1987. It said 1988 results also included a net gain of $44.2 million from the sale of a 20 percent interest in P.T. International Nickel Indonesia and an additional provision for Manitoba Mining taxes of $23.2 million. All figures are in U.S. funds.

title: Jays Sign Key
description: The Toronto Blue Jays signed Jimmy Key, the left-handed pitcher, to a four-year contract yesterday. The first three years are guaranteed. The fourth year, 1992, is at the club's option, but Key must be notified of the club's decision by Nov. 1, 1990. Otherwise the contract is not binding and Key may elect to become a free agent. By agreeing to the contract, Key and the Blue Jays avoided an arbitration hearing. Key had asked for $1.35 million and the Blue Jays countered with an offer of $1.2 million. The length of the contract was a surprise because the club had been following an unwritten policy of refusing to grant contracts for more than two years. Key missed two months last season after undergoing elbow surgery. He finished with a 12-5 record and a 3.29 earned-run average. In 1987 he was 17-8, with a league-leading e.r.a. of 2.76.(AP)

title: Facing Deadline, Shoreham Talks Are Adjourned
description: Less than a day before a Federal judge's deadline, talks to resolve a racketeering verdict against the Long Island Lighting Company - and possibly the future of the utility's $5.4 billion Shoreham nuclear power plant - adjourned last night with no indication of progress.

title: Q&A
description: Q. I recently decided to repaint my wood kitchen cabinets. They are finished with an avocado-colored oil- base enamel. I painted just one cabinet with a beige latex paint to see how I would like it. I did not prepare the surface in any way and the one coat did not cover too well. Also, it seems to be chipping off in places. Before I go any further, what did I do wrong and how should I proceed? A. I assume the original finish was a glossy enamel. If so, the old finish should have been sanded down with No. 80 sandpaper before starting to repaint, especially if you were going to repaint with a latex paint.

title: Ship's Oil Leak May Imperil Antarctic Wildlife
description: The Argentine supply ship that ran aground off Antarctica capsized and slowly sank in the frigid waters yesterday, leaving an apparently spreading oil slick and deepening concern over wildlife along the threatened shoreline.

title: A Warholian Whirl of Friends and Memories
description: It was just the sort of festivity that Andy Warhol would have immortalized with his Polaroid camera. ''He'd have been here, taking pictures - but then, he'd take pictures of anything, including a shadow,'' said the actor Dennis Hopper, who first met Warhol in 1961.

title: Philippine Troops Kill 32 Muslim Insurgents
description: Troops killed at least 32 Muslim rebels in their biggest battle with the insurgents since 1986, the army said today. The guerrillas had attacked a remote village in the southern Philippines.

title:
Currents;
Monumental Views
description: LEAD: DRAWINGS by Erik Gunnar Asplund, the Swedish architectural master of the early 20th century, are on view at Max Protech Gallery, 560 Broadway, at Prince Street, until March 1. . . . A stunning two-volume work, ''Monuments of Egypt: The Napoleonic Edition,'' $85, edited by C. C. Gillespie and Michel Dewachter, is out from Princeton Architectural Press.

title: Knight-Ridder Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After gains of $3,618,000 for the quarter and $9,608,000 for the year from the sales of broadcast operations. c-After gains from the sales of broadcast operations of $1,929,000 for the quarter and $6,429,000 for the year. The latest periods included a $13 million provision for anticipated severance and other costs to be incurred upon implementation of the joint operating agreement between its Detroit Free Press and Gannett Co.' Detroit News.

title: Home Improvement
description: MANY bathroom basins are fitted with pop-up drain plugs, which are usually operated by raising a lift rod in the center of the faucet. Although pop-up drains are convenient, they clog easily and need adjustment often.

title: THE TWO KOREAS AGREE TO DEVELOP RESORT IN NORTH
description: North and South Korea have agreed in principle to a joint business project, the first such agreement in 43 years of unremitting hostility between the two nations.

title: Drilling for Oil Falling in U.S.; Price Rises Seen
description: Faced with low oil prices and brighter drilling prospects abroad, oil and gas companies are continuing to cut spending on exploration in the United States.

title: Seized as a Shield In Street Gunfight, Boy, 3, Is Wounded
description: A 3-year-old boy was shot and seriously wounded on a Brooklyn street yesterday after an 18-year-old gunman, caught up in a wild shootout involving eight other men, grabbed the child from his mother and used him as a shield, the police said.

title: Badger Paper Mills reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
North Side Savings Bank reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The latest first quarter results included those of Richmond Hill Savings Bank, which was acquired in October. The year-ago per share figure was restated to give retroactive effect to a 10 percent stock dividend paid on Nov. 22, 1988.

title: Review/Opera; Giordano's 'Fedora,' Rare and Loud
description: The principal virtue of Umberto Giordano's ''Fedora,'' as played by the Opera Orchestra of New York at Carnegie Hall on Sunday night, was that the performance took place at all. This is meant in two ways.

title: Accounts
description: * Hartmarx Corporation to Berenter Greenhouse & Webster for Sansabelt slacks and sportwear, with a budget of $7.5 million to $8 million. Print media placement, trade advertising and direct mail will continue to be done by Hartmarx's in-house agency.

title: First Fincorp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The fourth quarter results reflected increases in loan loss reserves and a partial recovery of First Financial's deposits with the Financial Institutions Assurance Corp. which had been written off in 1985. The after-tax net effect of these amounts was to increase fourth quarter earnings by about $340,000, or 14 cents a share.

title: Personal Health
description: Women and their physicians have long labored under the dangerous myth that heart disease is an affliction of men. This discriminatory thinking has robbed millions of women of their health and life because preventive efforts have focused primarily on men.

title: Managua Acts to Revive Businesses
description: Soliciting broad support for their new program of economic austerity, Sandinista leaders have declared that their top priority will be to revitalize the country's beleaguered private business sector.

title: MCI Posts Big Profit Rise; Outlook for '89 Optimistic
description: Capping a year of record earnings growth, the MCI Communications Corporation said yesterday that its net income in the fourth quarter of 1988 rose fivefold on a 38 percent increase in revenues, compared with the comparable 1987 quarter.

title: Books of The Times; A Fictional Retelling of the Lisa Steinberg Case
description: Waverly Place By Susan Brownmiller 294 pages. Grove Press. $18.95.

title: A Change at Defense
description: With John G. Tower, the nominee for Secretary of Defense, still not in residence at the Pentagon, uncertainty over who will get the top Defense Department jobs continues. But the suspense is apparently over for at least one officeholder, even if the news is not good.

title: Baker's Decision-Making Process: An Early Test From the P.L.O.
description: On his first day of work last week, Secretary of State James A. Baker 3d found himself faced with conflicting advice from within the State Department on how to vote on a draft United Nations statement slightly critical of Israel. Administration officials say the new Secretary decided on a firm stand against the proposed document, prompting its sponsors, Palestinians and nonaligned nations, to withdraw it for now.

title: Ridgewood Properties reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
description: b-Net income

title: Bank Is Issuing Deposit Notes
description: The Bank of New England is offering $100 million of deposit notes due 1991 through underwriters led by Morgan Stanley & Company.

title: Playboy Enterprises Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a tax credit of $586,000 and $735,000 for the quarter and 6 months, respectively. c-Included a loss from discontinued operations of $82,000 for both periods and a tax credit of $1,143,000 and $1,757,000 for the quarter and 6 months, respectively.

title: Palestinian Rejects Role As Alternative to Arafat
description: If some in the Israeli Government see Faisal al-Husseini, a Palestinian nationalist, as a bright new hope, he says they had better think again.

title: Review/Ballet; Feld Opens, With a Nod to Petipa
description: The Feld Ballet has just turned 15 years old but there were no special references to that fact on Tuesday night when the company opened its six-week season at the Joyce Theater, 175 Eighth Avenue, at 19th Street. We had a look to the past, it is true, with ''The Consort,'' created in 1970. But the balance of the program was just Mr. Feld at his most typically provocative. Time spent with the Feld Ballet is time with a group of brightly personable and technically adept young dancers who seem ready for anything. It is also time spent with a thoughtful, intelligent choreographer intent on searching for new worlds.

title: Crossland Savings FSB reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a charge of $89.5 million from an accounting change for the quarter and year. c-Net income The per share results reflected preferred stock requirements, and the 1988 final net did not cover preferred requirements. The accounting change was related to Crossland's adoption of SFAS No. 96. All 1987 results have been restated for the adoption of SFAS No. 91.

title: '87 Law to Benefit the Mentally Ill May Instead Pose Threat to Them
description: A Federal law intended to assure that mentally ill and retarded people receive specialized treatment is raising the prospect that many such patients who live in nursing homes will be turned out with nowhere to get that treatment.

title: Bob Dunn, Cartoonist, 80
description: Bob Dunn, a cartoonist and writer for the syndicated comic strip ''They'll Do It Every Time,'' died of complications of diabetes Tuesday at Overlook Hospital in Summit, N.J. He was 80 years old and lived in the Short Hills section of Millburn, N.J.

title: Ipalco Enterprises Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Airborne Freight Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The company said the latest year included a net gain of $1,013,000, or 14 cents a share, from aircraft sales.

title: The $100,000 Casablanca Olympian
description: Bundled in sweat clothes, his dark eyes peering through dawn's early light, a wispy stranger from Casablanca was running in Central Park yesterday when some joggers recognized him.

title: An Explanation, at Last, on Macklowe
description: Incompetence, not malfeasance - that's City Hall's belated explanation of how New York let the developer Harry Macklowe convert punishment to profit. However unsettling that explanation, it is more reasonable than excuses that preceded it.

title: Abington Bancorp Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Midconn Bank reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Stop Pushing Shoreham On Long Islanders
description: To the Editor:

title: Weigh-Tronix Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Leakey Retracts Resignation As Head of Kenya Museums
description: Richard Leakey has withdrawn his resignation as director of the National Museums of Kenya, museum officials said today.

title: Gaylord Container Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a gain of $3.4 million from the sale of the company's Baltimore Mill.

title: Old National Bancorp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
MCI Communications Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a charge of $10 million for the early retirement of debt for the quarter and year. c-After a charge of $14 million for the quarter and year for the early retirement of debt.

title: Review/Television; Animal Rights vs. Human Rights on CBS
description: It's a busy ''48 Hours'' tonight, as the CBS camera chases animal-rights activists on their forays on behalf of cats, dogs, chimps, calves and deer and goes into the laboratories where animals are used in experiments that researchers maintain will help save the lives and health of humans. ''Animal Rights,'' at 8 P.M., does not tell much that we haven't already read on the well-reported subject, but it does provide some close-ups of who is doing what to whom.

title: Geonex Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss

title: Rebutting Witness, Tower Flatly Denies A Drinking Problem
description: Former Senator John G. Tower, responding to a witness who said he had seen him drunk on numerous occasions, told the Senate Armed Services Committee today that he does not have a drinking problem.

title: Family Court Judge Finds 10-Year-Old Did Sell Crack
description: A 10-year-boy was led away in tears and handcuffs today after a Suffolk County judge ruled that the youth had sold crack from a brown paper bag along a drug-plagued street in Wyandanch last month.

title: Elaine de Kooning, Artist and Teacher, Dies at 68
description: Elaine de Kooning, a painter, teacher and writer on art, died of lung cancer yesterday at Southampton (L.I.) Hospital. She was 68 years old and lived in East Hampton.

title: Parent & Child
description: MALCOLM MUSICANTE and his 15-year-old son, Ilya, now look at each other through wiser eyes. The trigger for the change, they both say, was their monthlong camping trip two summers ago. Ilya's mother, Sandy Musicante, decided ahead of time that the trip would go better if she stayed at home.

title: Great Northern Nekoosa Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The company said sales in 1988 reflect the acquisition of Jim Walter Papers in August.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''I think I'm worth 1 percent of what Sugar Ray Leonard makes. I think I'm worth 7 percent of what Tom Brokaw makes.'' - Representative Bill Gray, Democrat of Pennsylvania, backing a raise for Congress. [ D20:4. ]

title: American Petrofina Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Doubts Surround Hangings in Gandhi Slaying
description: To the Editor:

title: Nipsco Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Statewide Bancorp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The per share results reflected preferred stock dividend requirements.

title: Metrobank reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Salary Cut for Mets' Aguilera
description: The Mets reached agreement with another pitcher yesterday, but unlike Ron Darling, with whom they concluded an agreement on Monday, Rick Aguilera took a cut in pay.

title: DISPUTE EMBROILS WIFE OF MANDELA
description: A controversy has flared around Winnie Mandela, the anti-apartheid figure, over allegations that her bodyguards abducted and harmed four young men in a black township. The youngest, who was 14 years old, is still missing.

title: Lights Keep Flashing On the Scoreboard
description: Loyola Marymount and United States International ran through the National Collegiate Athletic Association record book again as they ended one of the oddest home-and-home series ever seen in college basketball.

title: Calendar: A Celebration of Passover
description: For a Festival of Spring, The Jewish Museum, 1109 Fifth Avenue at 92d Street; 212-860-1860.

title: Penney Plans Sale Of Insurance Unit
description: The J. C. Penney Company said that it had put its J. C. Penney Casualty Insurance Company up for sale and that it was holding preliminary talks with several companies. The giant retailer, based in Plano, Tex., said that it had decided to abandon the in-store insurance business because the expected synergy between the company's retail operations and personal financial services had failed to materialize.

title: Hon Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included income from discontinued operations of $164,000 and $1,246,000 for the quarter and year, respectively; and a gain of $8,269,000 for both the quarter and year. c-Included income from discontinued operations of $644,000 for the quarter and $1,310,000 for the year.

title: Close to Home
description: AT Z o'clock in the afternoon, every day but Sunday, three elderly people gather in the kitchen of a white clapboard house. One of the women mixes herself a vodka martini, using vodka from her bottle. The other woman makes a vodka and tonic, using vodka from her bottle. The man, the oldest at 94, is the only Scotch drinker among them, so there is no confusion about which is his bottle. Sometimes one of the three sticks a bag of potato chips or a box of Triscuits in the middle of the table.

title: Avemco Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a losses on the sale of investments of $38,000 and $111,000 for the quarter and year, respectively. c-Included gains on the sale of investments of $62,000 for the quarter and $1,220,000 for the year.

title: Israel Currency Reserves
description: Israel's foreign currency reserves jumped $1.22 billion in January as speculators sold dollars purchased before a turn-of-the-year devaluation of the shekel, the Bank of Israel said today. The reserves now stand at $4.63 billion, back to the level they had reached before a speculative flight into the dollar drained Israel's currency stock in November and December.

title: F.D.I.C. Adopts Position On Bank Swap Agreements
description: The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation has decided that in the event of a bank's involvency the courts should enforce the bank's agreements that combine gains and losses on all swaps with a single customer.

title: NO U.S. POLICY YET ON AFGHANISTAN
description: Despite an assertion by President Bush last week that the United States would play a ''catalytic'' role in bringing stability to Afghanistan, the United States has yet to develop a comprehensive strategy to deal with the post-Soviet era there, senior Administration officials say.

title: Jets Hire Hawkins as Coach of Defense
description: The Jets named Ralph Hawkins as their new defensive coordinator today and then made his job easier by protecting virtually all the key players on defense.

title: Integra Financial reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Integra Financial is a combination of Penn Bancorp and Union National Corp. whose merger was effective last Thursday. As a result, earnings are presented on a consolidated basis since the merger was accounted for as a pooling of interests.

title: Pepperell Offer Raised By Farley to $52 a Share
description: In a plea for stockholder support on the eve of a proxy fight seeking to change the top management of West Point-Pepperell Inc., Farley Inc. said yesterday that it was sweetening its offer for the textile producer to $52 a share, or $1.4 billion in cash.

title: Western Federal Savings Bank reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The bank said the latest quarter included an additional provision for possible loan losses of about $600,000. The latest year included an after- tax non-recurring penalty of $2.2 million from the early payment of Federal Home Loan Bank advances.

title: Panhandle Eastern reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included an extraordinary gain of $14,820,000. c-Net income and included for the year a loss from discontinued operations of $1,461,000. The company said that for 1988 the decision to divide equally between customers and shareholders its take- or-pay settlement or contract reformation costs resulted in an after-tax charge of $244 million. The disposition of 3 million shares of Quantum Chemical Corp. common stock resulted in an after-tax gain in 1988 of $64 million, or $1.17. The company said results for the latest fourth-quarter included an aftertax charge of $51 million. The charge is related to a ruling by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission, ordering the company's Trunkline LNG Co. unit to refund, with interest, to its customers revenue collected from 1982 to 1984. The company is seeking a rehearing of this order.

title: Deaths of Dolphins Are Linked by U.S. To Natural Causes
description: Hundreds of bottlenose dolphins found dead on East Coast shores two summers ago were poisoned after eating fish contaminated with a toxin from an algae rarely found in those waters, a National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration study has concluded.

title: Circle K Move Lifts Stock 18%
description: Shares of the Circle K Corporation rose sharply today after the large convenience store operator said it had hired an investment banker to explore options to enhance value for shareholders.

title: Sports Day for Women
description: President Bush, an avid horseshoe pitcher become Commander in Chief, undoubtedly knows that ''close only counts in horseshoes and hand grenades.'' In recognition of that - sort of - he will receive a gold-plated horseshoe today as part of the third annual National Girls and Women in Sports Day celebration of the Women's Sports Foundation.

title: Swift New Ferries Carry the Hopes of Jersey's Bayshore
description: The tides that lap against the miles of beaches along the Raritan and Sandy Hook Bays have created good times and bad for the small shoreline towns there. Now, a revival of waterborne travel to New York is promising to end the latest cycle of decline in dramatic fashion.

title: Compaq Profit Up 88% In Quarter
description: The Compaq Computer Corporation, still outpacing the growth rate of the personal-computer market, said today that its profits soared by 88 percent in the fourth quarter.

title: A Drug Suspect Dies, Starting Tampa Melee
description: Rock-and-bottle throwing broke out tonight in a housing project when a suspect died in a drug arrest, and more than 100 police officers turned out to quell the disturbance, the police said.

title: Starsignal's Color Fax
description: Starsignal Inc. has introduced what it calls the first facsimile machine that can send full-color pictures over conventional telephone lines. The company said this week that the device, which costs $19,000, will be aimed at the growing desktop publishing market and other uses that require fast transmission of color images. The transmitted image could be printed out or electronically stored on the other end. The company will start shipping the fax machine in quantity in March.

title: Hoyas' Pressure Defense and Shot-Blocking Stop Seton Hall
description: With first place on the line and pride at stake, Georgetown broke Seton Hall's hex tonight and re-asserted itself in the Big East with a 74-66 victory over the Pirates at the Capital Centre.

title: Primebank reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
HAZARD REPORTED IN APPLE CHEMICAL
description: The Environmental Protection Agency said today that a chemical used chiefly on about 5 percent of the nation's red apples poses a significant risk of cancer in humans, but the agency will permit it to remain on the market for at least 18 months.

title: Southwest Airlines Co reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Results for 1988 included a $3,600,000 gain from the sale of certain financial assets and a $5,500,000 gain from aircraft sales. Results for 1987 included $10,200,000 income from the disposal of Transtar assets less shutdown expenses and a $4,300,000 gain from the sale of certain financial assets.

title:
Currents;
Americans Reinterpret Claridge's
description: LEAD: TWO New York interior designers, Elissa Cullman and Hedi Kravis, and their London partner, Nancy Prentice, who is also American, have just completed a suite for Claridge's Hotel in London.

title: Compaq Computer Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a tax benefit which increased net equal to 14 cents a share.

title: Lear Joins With Columbia To Produce TV, Not Manage
description: Norman Lear, creator of ''All in the Family'' and one of the most innovative producers of comedy shows in television history, said today that he would return to producing programs after a long hiatus.

title: Koch Must Tiptoe Across Fine Line in Battle of Budgets
description: The combination of an election year and a painful fiscal year poses a problem for Mayor Edward I. Koch that goes beyond revenues and expenditures. Mr. Koch, who is hardly known for watching his words, must find a way to challenge Gov. Mario M. Cuomo's budget without irritating the Governor.

title: Platinum for Sherwood
description: Sherwood & Schneider has been chosen by Johnson Matthey, the world's largest platinum refiner, to help it market the metal to investors and industrialists. One spot, for a ''Platinum Dragon'' medallion commemorating the Chinese New Year, has already been tested on cable television. No budget figures were disclosed.

title: Desoto Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a gain of $1,500,000.

title: Midfed Savings Bank reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
French Begin Insider Inquiry
description: The state prosecutor's office opened a criminal inquiry today into insider trading involving businessmen with ties to France's Socialist Government.

title: Review/Music; Peggy Lee Sings the Blues
description: Peggy Lee has always been a spellbinding singer - a weaver of moods and colors. But for her new show, which opened Tuesday evening at the Ballroom, 253 West 28th Street, she has created an illustrated narrative, ''The Blues Branch of the Jazz Tree,'' in which she traces the development of the blues with spoken settings that have the same magnetically mood-evoking qualities as her singing.

title: Home Port Bancorp Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Guardian Bancorp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The year-ago per share earnings adjusted to reflect 5-for-4 stock split effective July 15, 1988.

title: Unwed Couple Is Denied Emergency Housing
description: An unwed couple expecting their third child ''are creating children for the welfare rolls,'' a judge said Tuesday in blocking their request to overturn an agency's ban on housing unmarried couples.

title: Allegheny International Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 1
description: b-Included a tax credit of $2,400,000. Earnings for both periods failed to cover preferred stock requirements.

title: Stanley Works reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a $9,698,000 loss on the disposal of discontinued operations.

title: Stride-Rite Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 2
description: b-Included losses from discontinued operations of $2,827,000 and $4,677,000 for the quarter and year, respectively, and the year also included a $1,723,000 gain from the cumulative effect of an accounting change. c-Included net from discontinued operations of $538,000 and $394,000 for the quarter and year, respectively. The company said that for fiscal 1988 LIFO had the effect of reducing income from continuing operations by $4,330,000, or 32 cents a shae, compared to a reduction of $1,343,000, or 9 cents a share, last year.

title: CMS Energy Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Eastern Talks: Cooling-Off Set
description: The National Mediation Board today notified Eastern Airlines and its machinists' union that a 30-day clock is about to start ticking on their stalled contract talks.

title: An Alternative Plan for the Gloom of Winter
description: One way for anglers to deal with winter's doldrums would be to attend the four-part Theodore Gordon Flyfishers' annual arts of angling program, which begins next Thursday with the author and educator Joe Humphries revealing what he knows, which is considerable, about fishing the dry fly.

title: Victoria Bankshares Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Laurence, Charles Gets Trump Casino Account
description: Laurence, Charles, Free & Lawson will do the advertising, publicity and trade promotion for the Trump Taj Mahal Casino Resort in Atlantic City. The casino is not scheduled to open until the spring of 1990, but Thomas E. Lawson, the president of the agency, said that trade appeals to convention and meeting managers would begin immediately and that advertising would start in the fall.

title: Corrections
description: A table in Business Day on Jan. 3 showing the 1988 performance of over-the-counter stocks described an action by the ABQ Corporation incorrectly. It made inquiries about buying a savings and loan unit, not selling one.

title: KEY RATES
Mentor Graphics Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Appeals Judge Chosen by Bush To Be Solicitor
description: President Bush announced today that he would nominate Federal Judge Kenneth W. Starr of Washington, a conservative whose opinions have tended to limit the powers of the judiciary, to be Solicitor General, the Administraton's chief advocate before the Supreme Court.

title: Whirlpool Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included the previously-announced decision to sell the company's kitchen cabinet business and resulted in a 1988 after-tax loss on disposal of $45 million.
