description: The Pennzoil Company confirmed today that it had acquired 8 percent of Burlington Resources Inc., a new energy company with large natural gas reserves.

title: Delays Faulted in Death Sentence Appeals
description: Chief Justice William H. Rehnquist called again today for changes in the procedure for appealing death sentences, saying the present system invites delays in executions that extend for years.

title: Adage Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After net from discontinued operations of $89,000 and $11,354,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively, and 9 months also included a $1,818,000 extraordinary credit. c-Net loss d-After net from discontinued operations of $1,687,000 for the quarter and $4,614,000 for the 9 months. The company said the year-ago third quarter included a $19,360,000 charge from a writedown related to a consolidation of product lines. Latest 9-month loss from continuing operations included a charge of $1,119,000 for expenses relating to long-term lease obligations of vacant facilities. Year-ago loss from discontinued operations included a charge of $21,460,000 from the consolidation of product lines and costs associated with a work force reduction and facility closings.

title: Metro Datelines; Former F.B.I. Agent Charged in Sex Case
description: A former F.B.I. agent was arrested yesterday on charges that he sexually molested 10 boys in a soccer league, the Nassau County police said.

title: Manville Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included income from discontinued operations of $1,532,000 and $6,879,000 for the quarter and year, respectively, and a $1,287,912,000 charge in connection with a reorganization plan for both periods, and a charge of $106,937,000 from an accounting change for the year. c-Included income from discontinued operations of $2,188,000 and $7,015,000 for the quarter and year, respectively, and a charge of $91,473,000 in connection with the reorganization plan for both periods. d-Net income The company said it has about $270 million in cash and marketable securities on hand after expenses related to the completion of its reorganization plan. The issuance of debt and equity securities valued in excess of $1.5 billion in connection with the plan leaves the company with equity of about $800 million. The company filed for reorganization under Chapter 11 on Aug. 26, 1982. Its plan of reorganization was completed and the company emerged from bankruptcy on Nov. 28, 1988.

title: Harvard to Meet B.U. For Beanpot Crown
description: Harvard hung on in the final period tonight to beat Boston College, 5-4, in the opening game of the Beanpot Tournament at Boston Garden. The Crimson could not win a face-off or keep the puck out of their zone in the last 20 minutes. The Eagles' attack against Chuckie Hughes, the brilliant Harvard goalie, was furious but futile.

title: F.D.A. Allows Wider Use of Drug to Prevent Pneumonia in AIDS Patients
description: The Food and Drug Administration announced today that it would allow wider availability of an experimental aerosol drug that helps prevent a life-threatening type of pneumonia that often strikes AIDS patients.

title: G.M. Lifts Dividends On 3 Stocks
description: The General Motors Corporation, on the verge of announcing record annual profits, today increased the dividend on all three classes of its common stock.

title: Rules Are Tightened on Deductions
description: Although Federal income tax rates are now at the lowest level of the postwar years, the rules on itemized deductions have been tightened considerably. And some rules, like those governing the deductibility of interest, are more complex than ever.

title: G-R-I Corp reports earnings for Year to Nov 30
description: b-After a loss of $6,556,000 from an accounting change. c-Net income

title: Magma Copper Co reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss

title: FPL Group Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Latest fourth quarter included a pretax gain of $68 million from the sale of the information units of Praxis Group Inc. The company said revenue results reflect the consolidation of three previously unconsolidated subsidiaries, in accordance with new accounting requirements. The consolidation had no effect on net income or earnings per share.

title: Atlanta Cartoonist Resigns
description: Doug Marlette, the editorial cartoonist who last year brought The Atlanta Constitution its first Pulitzer Prize in 20 years, resigned from the newspaper yesterday to become a cartoonist at Newsday.

title: The Red Cross Resumes Its Operations in Beirut
description: The International Committee of the Red Cross announced today that it was resuming operations in Lebanon after a seven-week suspension that followed death threats to its personnel.

title: NEWS SUMMARY
description: INTERNATIONAL A3-13 The last step of the Soviet pullout from Afghanistan was marked by a show for the press in the dusty border city of Termez. The ceremony was more weary than festive, and just a bit premature. Page A1

title: Yugoslavia Inflation Up
description: Yugoslavia's inflation jumped to 290 percent last month, official figures showed today. The Federal Bureau of Statistics said prices had soared by a monthly record of 39 percentage points from the 251 percent inflation registered at the end of 1988. Economists said that the January rises were highest in services, farm products and energy and that they reflected the gradual elimination of price controls by the Government of Branko Mikulic, who resigned Dec. 30 as Prime Minister.

title: Qubix Graphic Systems reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
The Face on the Wall
description: The Gipper is history at the White House in more ways that one. For years, smiling pictures of Ronald Reagan donned the wall in the West Wing, including the part known as the upper press office. Snapshots of a President in action: Mr. Reagan with heads of state, Mr. Reagan meeting the press, Mr. Reagan with his wife, Nancy.

title: Market Place; View on Sears: Wait and See
description: SEARS, ROEBUCK & COMPANY, now in the early stages of a restructuring, will report its fourth-quarter results this week, and they are expected to be flat or only slightly better than last year's.

title: New England Critical Care reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Two Budget Tales of Prudence and Pain; Some Cuomo Medicaid Cuts Could Increase Costs
description: Gov. Mario Cuomo proposes reducing New York's $2 billion budget deficit by squeezing $310 million out of spending on Medicaid health insurance for the poor. That also squeezes New York City's budget since the city shares costs of the program with Albany and Washington. For the most part, this is no exercise in budget cruelty. As much as two-thirds of the saving would come from cost containment beneficial to both city and state.

title: CNW Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a loss of $5,179,000 for the quarter and a gain from discontinued operations of $2,736,000 for the year, and the year also included a gain of $22,224,000 from the sale of manufacturing segment and a loss of $13,229,000 from bond redemptions. c-After gains from discontinued operations of $5,358,000 and $13,642,000 for the quarter and year, respectively, and the year also included a loss of $2,466,000 from bond redemptions.

title: RESULTS PLUS
description: HORSE RACING Socially Informed Triumphs: Socially Informed, ridden by Richard Migliore, raced to a front-running 1 1/2-length victory in the featured race at Aqueduct yesterday. Make Luck was runner-up in the field of six, 2 1/2 lengths ahead of Dancing Pretense. Socially Informed, the favorite, covered six furlongs on the fast track in 1:09 4/5 to earn $21,600 for James Riccio with his second victory in three starts this year. The winner returned $5.20, $3.20 and $2.20 for $2 across the board. Make Luck paid $4.20 and $2.40, and Dancing Pretense was worth $2.40 to show.(AP) COLLEGE BASKETBALL/WOMEN Maryland 106, Georgia Tech 74: Sixth-ranked Maryland, led by Carla Holmes with 22 points, won its 10th consecutive game last night with the victory in the Atlantic Coast Conference game at College Park, Md. Maryland is 18-2 and 8-1. Georgia Tech dropped to 12-9 and 4-6. Maryland, which leads the nation in field-goal percentage, shot 61 percent from the field while holding the Yellow Jackets to 43 percent. Ida Neal led Georgia Tech with 21 points.(AP) N.B.A. Suns 104, Jazz 87: Tom Chambers scored 11 of his 24 points in the fourth quarter as Phoenix averted a second-half collapse to win at home. Phoenix, 20-4 at home, led by 52-38 at halftime behind Kevin Johnson's 13 points and Armon Gilliam's 12. Six points from Gilliam in an 8-2 run put the Suns ahead, 66-45, with 7:02 left in the third quarter before the Jazz rallied. Karl Malone scored 6 points and Thurl Bailey had a layup, a jumper and a dunk in a 20-6 run that cut it to 72-65 with 39 seconds left in the period. The Suns, ahead by 74-65, opened the fourth quarter with an 8-0 run.(AP)

title: Senators Fight Baker's Choice for Latin Post
description: Several Republican and Democratic members of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee have strong reservations about the pending nomination of Bernard W. Aronson as the State Department's top policy maker on Latin America, senators and their staff members said today.

title: Profits Scoreboard
Congress: Pathology of a Pay Raise
description: LEAD: The occasional public exercise of setting salaries for members of Congress brings out several of the pathologies with which our political system is richly endowed. House Speaker Jim Wright's call for a vote on the pay raise for public officials is a case in point. Even a Washington-watcher from the other side of the continent can spot three symptoms.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: * Bankers Trust Company said Douglas G. Hoffman, a former principal with Tillinghast Management Consultants, would join the banking company as a senior vice president.

title: New York School Decentralization Needs Help, Not Overhauling
description: To the Editor:

title: Having Too Much, Appreciating Too Little
description: To the Editor:

title: Kollmorgen Seeks Alternatives to Bid
description: The Kollmorgen Corporation said it was in talks with third parties to discuss possible alternatives to the $294 million hostile tender offer from the Vernitron Corporation. In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, Kollmorgen said it had furnished financial information to the parties, but the Stamford, Conn., electrical machinery concern emphasized that it had made no decision to sell the company. Last month, the Kollmorgen board rejected as inadequate the $23-a-share offer from Vernitron, a Lake Success, L.I., medical equipment manufacturer.

title: Careers; A Key Role In Corporate Real Estate
description: JAMES G. LAW, 44 years old, has a top job in what he calls an emerging career field - corporate real estate management.

title: Mercury Savings & Loan Assn reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Son Links Navajos' Leader To Cover-Up in Land Case
description: The son of the leader of the nation's largest Indian tribe, the Navajos, implicated his father today in an effort to cover up thousands of dollars in gifts that the family received from a close friend who sold land of questionable value to the tribe.

title: Whites: 140 Blacks: 3
description: LEAD: A lot of people, most of them white, call affirmative action ''reverse discrimination'' and wonder why black people shouldn't be satisfied with a simple repudiation of discrimination of any kind. With its ruling striking down minority set-asides in city construction contracts, the Supreme Court seems to have decided that affirmative action programs in general violate white people's right to equal protection.

title: Our Towns; One Small World In the Midst Of the Maelstrom
description: rrFor 44 years John Randolph lived in institutions for the retarded. Then, in the early 80's, someone realized that was a mistake. As Mr. Randolph said, ''They decided at that time I was more fit to be able to be put out in the world.''

title: Corrections
description: An entry in the Executive Changes listing of Business Day yesterday about Nestle Enterprises misidentified its new senior vice president. He is E. Michael Moone.

title: Russian Music Series
description: The New York University Chamber Music Society is to give the second concert in its series the Year of Russian Music on Thursday at 8 P.M. at Merkin Concert Hall, 129 West 67th Street. Subsequent dates in the series are March 23, April 3 (at the University Theater, 35 West Fourth Street), April 13 and May 17. Tickets are $15; a four-concert subscription is $40. Information: 362-8719.

title: Alaska Air Group Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a gain of $11,378,000 from an accounting change. The company said 1987 results included the $9 million loss of its former Jet America unit.

title: Salvador Offers Solutions, but Will We Listen?
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. Rig Count Falls
description: The number of working oil and natural gas rigs dropped last week by 17, to a total of 780, Baker Hughes Inc. reported today. A year ago, the number of rigs totaled 986. The count is a widely watched industry index of drilling activity, and it reflects the number of rigs actively exploring for oil as of last Friday, not the number of rigs actively producing oil.

title: Nicaragua Devalues Currency
description: The Sandinista Government devalued the currency and raised prices for petroleum products today for the third time this year. The devaluation, from 2,300 to 2,700 cordobas to the dollar, is part of economic measures designed to contain inflation that has reached an annual rate of 36,000 percent.

title: Kentucky Central Life Insurnce Co reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The latest year results included a gain from the sale of broadcasting properties of $2.6 million. The year-ago quarter included an after-tax gain of $3 million from the sale of broadcasting properties and a tax benefit. The 1987 year included a gain of $10.1 million from the sale of broadcasting properties and a gain of $4.1 million from a tax benefit.

title: Florida State Stops Louisville by 81-78
description: George McCloud made two foul shots with five seconds left tonight and No. 12 Florida State held on to upset No. 4 Louisville, 81-78.

title: Shevardnadze Ends Pakistan Trip With Little Gain
description: The Soviet Foreign Minister, Eduard A. Shevardnadze, left Pakistan for Moscow today with almost nothing to show for his last-minute attempt to insure a peaceful transition in Afghanistan.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; A Computer Magazine Featuring 3-D Glasses
description: The publishers of a computer trade magazine hope that the 3-D effect, which was used in a ballyhooed advertisement for Coca-Cola during the Super Bowl telecast last month, will add sparkle to the less effervescent world of computer hardware and software.

title: Elizabeth Chapman Little, Administrator, 77
description: Elizabeth Chapman Little, chairwoman of the board of the Bruce Museum in Greenwich, Conn., from 1983 until last year, died of cancer on Saturday at Greenwich Hospital. She was 77 years old and lived in Greenwich.

title: Amax Gold Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The company said net in the latest fourth quarter and year was reduced by an $8.7 million fourth quarter writedown of the carrying value in its Canamax Resources Inc. subsidiary.

title: U.S. and Argentina Beginning Cleanup of Antarctic Oil Spill
description: American and Argentine crews are beginning the slow and dirty job of cleaning up the devastating oil spill from the polar supply ship that ran aground and capsized off the Antarctic Peninsula.

title: 4 Found Dead in Lake Shack
description: A fisherman found four teen-agers dead early Sunday in their shanty on frozen Harpt Lake. They had been overcome by carbon monoxide from propane heaters and a propane hot plate after taking part in a weekend ice-fishing derby. Officials said they had not determined if the heaters in the 7-by-6 1/2-foot plywood shanty were malfunctioning or were just poorly vented.

title: Increase in Precious Metals Follows Late Rally in Gold
description: Precious metals closed higher yesterday after gold prices rebounded from a two-year intraday low.

title: Voplex Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss

title: Abiomed Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Democracy At Its Worst
description: When Jimmy Carter was campaigning for President in 1976, he frequently said that the country needed ''a government as good as the people.'' Sometimes, however, the people are the problem, as demonstrated once again by their fury over a necessary and justified salary rise proposed for members of Congress and other Federal officials.

title: Patterns of Abuse Detected In Alcoholics and Drug Users
description: Experts on alcoholism say previous dependence on addicting drugs may increase the risk of becoming dependent on another addicting drug.

title: U.S. and Vietnam Make Progress on Questions About the Missing
description: To the Editor:

title: Crompton & Knowles Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After loss from discontinued continued operations of $477,000 and $597,000 for the quarter and year, respectively, and a loss of $920,000 on disposal of discontinued operations for both the quarter and year. c-After losses from discontinued operations of $155,000 for the quarter and $262,000 for the year.

title: Jefferies Takes Stand In GAF Trial
description: Boyd L. Jefferies, the central Government witness in a number of major securities fraud cases, returned to the witness stand in the Federal Court House in Manhattan yesterday in the second trial of the GAF Corporation and a senior executive on charges of stock manipulation.

title: Chelsea Industries
description: The Kane Miller Corporation offered of $27 a share for Chelsea Industries, a Boston film manufacturer. Kane Miller's offer represents a 48 percent premium over Chelsea's price today of $18.25, up 12.5 cents, on the New York Stock Exchange. Kane Miller, a Tarrytown, N.Y., food processor, estimated the total price of its offer at $55 million. A copy of the offer was contained in a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission. Kane Miller already controls 9.6 percent of Chelsea's stock.

title: Coach Stays, Team Forfeits
description: Florida A&M was awarded a 2-0 forfeit over Morgan State tonight because the Morgan State coach, Nat Frazier, refused to leave the building after he was ejected.

title: Paraguay's Leader Denies Ties to Drug Trafficking
description: Trying to dispel rumors of drug connections, Paraguay's new leader today denied any involvement in narcotics trafficking and pledged to fight what he called ''one of mankind's worst scourges.''

title: West 49th To the N.H.L. All-Stars
description: rrAround the corner from the litter on Ninth Avenue, people still live in some of the tenements. But what was once a five-story red-brick building of railroad flats at 416 West 49th Street, is gutted now and all but abandoned. In this area known as Hell's Kitchen, rusted roll-up metal doors protect the food store on the ground floor that supplies more than two dozen hot-dog and hot-pretzel vendor carts stored there at night. Above, the windows on the black-iron fire escape are boarded shut.

title: Rangers Lose Grip On First
description: There wasn't a better description of the state of the Rangers than the dispassionate one offered by Neal Broten of Minnesota as he stood in a tunnel in Madison Square Garden Sunday night and cast an appraising glance in the direction of the funereal Ranger locker room.

title: Boyden Gray's Judgment
description: In December, Boyden Gray, counsel to President Bush, spoke of the new Administration's hopes to elevate Government ethics. Mr. Bush had always sought ''the highest possible standards for himself and those who work for him,'' Mr. Gray said at an ethics conference. ''I hope I'm up to the task of watching it for him.''

title:
BUSINESS PEOPLE;
G.M. Picks Successor To a Bush Nominee
description: LEAD: The General Motors Corporation yesterday named Robert J. Schultz executive vice president for high technology, succeeding Donald J. Atwood, who has been nominated to become Deputy Secretary of Defense.

title: Delay on Tower Worries G.O.P.
description: Further delays of a vote by the Senate Armed Services Committee could make the nomination of John G. Tower as Defense Secretary politically untenable, Republican committee members said yesterday.

title: Cambridge Bioscience Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
TV STATION FIGHT IN ALABAMA GROWS
description: The purchase of Montgomery's leading television station by the state's pension fund has set off a bitter political battle that escalated today when Gov. Guy Hunt filed an appeal seeking to block it.

title: Southwest Water Co reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
G.E.C. and Siemens Revise Plessey Bid
description: The General Electric Company P.L.C. of Britain and Siemens A.G. of West Germany revised their bid for the Plessey Company to overcome the British Government's concern that a takeover would reduce competition. The hostile bid for Plessey, a military-electronics and telecommunications group, lapsed in January when it was referred to Britain's Monopolies and Mergers Commission.

title: Compumat Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
description: The company said the 1987 fourth quarter and full year results are restated to reflect an acquisition accounted for as a pooling of interests.

title: Warsaw Opens Parley With Solidarity
description: The Government and the banned labor union Solidarity began discussions today on broad political and economic change in Poland. The Government offered to reinstate the union and give it a share of parliamentary power through ''nonconfrontational elections'' in exchange for Solidarity support of Government economic programs.

title: Baldwin Technology reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Computer Factory Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Latest quarter included a reserve of about 2 cents a share against potential losses related to prepayments to one of its major suppliers.

title: Harmon Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Nancy Reagan Drug Center Overcomes Environment Bar
description: Nancy Reagan's proposed drug clinic passed its first test Friday when it was ruled that the center's sponsors will not have to file a report on its impact on the environment.

title: Reich & Tang LP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Comparable prior year figures are not applicable; partnership commenced operations on June 1, 1987.

title: Soviets, Delighted to Survive, Tolerate the Afghan Hoopla
description: The Soviet Union marked the final stage of its withdrawal from Afghanistan with a show for the press today in this dusty border city.

title: Chess
description: The Soviet grandmaster Artur Yusupov brilliantly defeated the Canadian grandmaster Kevin Spraggett in a sudden-death playoff Saturday to win their world championship candidates' quarterfinal match in Quebec and advance to the semifinal stage.

title: Walker Joins Contest
description: Kenny Walker of the Knicks and two rookies, Shelton Jones of the Philadelphia 76ers and Chris Morris of the Nets, have been added to the field for the National Basketball Association's slam-dunk championship Saturday at Houston. The three additions followed by one day the withdrawal of Michael Jordan of the Bulls, the two-time defending champion, who has a sprained knee.

title: Coast Distribution System reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
Tapping Atari's Power
description: THE Atari Mega ST2 and ST4, reported on here last week, bring an amazing amount of power to the home or office at the price of far less advanced computers. But the hardware doesn't mean a thing without software to drive it, and the software available for the ST's is a small fraction of the bounty available for I.B.M.-compatible machines.

title: Isuzu Revamps U.S. Operations
description: The Japanese car maker Isuzu Motors Ltd. said on Sunday that it had reorganized its operations in the United States, placing Isuzu Motors America Inc., with headquarters in Detroit, in charge of its four subsidiaries.

title: Alberta Natural Gas reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: The company said share earnings in 1988 reflect the effect of a rights offering last May which increased the number of shares outstanding by about 16 percent. The company said 1988 earnings were affected by a 2-cent-per-share writeoff resulting from the withdrawal from the Soligaz project. Also, last December the company had a writedown of 62 cents a share resulting from the curtailing of the full- scale operation of the California Erythromycin facility. Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; People
description: * Jean Manuel Guyader has joined BBDO, New York, as a senior vice president and creative director.

title: Channel 2 Plans New Show at 7 P.M.
description: In another attempt to bolster ratings in its early evening time period, the flagship CBS television station in New York, WCBS or Channel 2, announced yesterday that starting Feb. 27, ''This Evening,'' a new half-hour magazine program, would replace the game show ''Win, Lose or Draw'' at 7 P.M.

title: Reviews/Dance; Studying Love's Motion
description: Eliot Feld's two latest ballets are a study in contrast. ''Kore'' is a solo that continues the choreographer's exploration of Minimalist music by Steve Reich. ''Love Song Waltzes,'' danced to Brahms's music of the same title, sets four couples spinning in a neo-romantic mood.

title: Businesses Offering to Match Gifts to Neediest Cases Fund
description: The partners of two real-estate concerns have worked out an unusual matching-gifts program with the residents of two apartment buildings in lower Manhattan to benefit The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: Moroccan Envoy Back
description: An old Washington hand, Ambassador Ali Bengelloun of Morocco, has returned for his third tour of duty in Washington. He and his wife, Jackie, were a popular team on their first tour, in the Kennedy and Johnson years, early 1962 until mid-1965. They returned in 1977 for seven years and made their embassy residence popular with dinner parties at which guests dipped their fingers into a common pot of bastilla (pigeon pie).

title: Klima Begins Jail Term
description: Petr Klima of the Detroit Red Wings began a two-day jail term in Royal Oak, Mich., yesterday for driving under the influence of alchohol last fall when he was on probation for a previous drunken-driving offense.

title: Israeli Alleges P.L.O. Terror
description: Foreign Minister Moshe Arens lashed out today at the United States and other Western nations, asserting that an attempted guerrilla raid on Sunday proved that the Palestine Liberation Organization had not truly renounced terrorism.

title: INSIDE
description: Your Taxes The rules on itemized deductions have been tightened and those on the deductibility of interest are more complex than ever. Second article in a series. Page D1. Living With AIDS For many gay men, AIDS means uneasy survival and hope mixed with despair, rather than early death.

title: Andre Cayatte, Film Maker, Is Dead at 80
description: Andre Cayatte, a lawyer turned film maker who was known for his films on crime and justice, died of heart failure Sunday at his home. He was 80 years old.

title: Corrections
description: Because of an editing error, a report in the Business People column on Thursday about Crazy Eddie Inc. described management changes incorrectly. Elias Zinn stepped down as president and chief executive but remains a director. Victor H. Palmieri remains chairman. Peter A. Martosella, the new president and chief executive, previously served as president and chief executive of the Baldwin-United Corporation on behalf of the Palmieri Company.

title: Bay Financial Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Comparable year-ago figures not applicable; company has changed the end of its second quarter to Dec. 31 from Nov. 30 in 1987.

title: Blow To Speaker
description: Bowing to a wave of national outrage, the House of Representatives today abandoned its leadership and forced a vote for Tuesday that is expected to kill a proposed 51 percent Congressional pay increase.

title: Gay Men Find Sadness Colors Life As They Make the Most of the Days
description: There is a photograph that hangs on the wall in an apartment in the East Village that sums up the impact of AIDS on the lives of gay men. Taken some nine months ago, it shows two young men in the prime of life, both seemingly in good health, both smiling.

title: Ametek Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $2,194,000 and $8,136,000 for the quarter and year, respectively, and the year also included a gain from an accounting adjustment of $3,633,000. c-Included net from discontinued operations of $63,000 for the quarter and $4,481,000 for the year.

title: Missing Jogger, 11, Is Found
description: An 11-year-old youth reported missing from his home in Harlem last Friday after he went jogging but never returned was found yesterday by Transit Authority police wandering in Pennsylvania Station. The boy, Kareen Stembridge of West 148th Street, told the police that he did not go home because he feared he had failed one of his classes at Intermediate School 223.

title: Fisher Transportation reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
description: b-Net loss The company said the decrease in net loss resulted from elimination of older, less efficient equipment; nonrecurring writeoffs in 1987 and increasing revenue per loaded mile on the remaining units.

title: Investor Seeking To Buy DeSoto
description: DeSoto Inc.'s stock jumped $8.50 today, to $49.50 a share, after a New York securities firm said it had agreed to sell a 14.71 percent stake in the chemical-coating manufacturer to an investor who wants to buy the company. The 20.7 percent gain in DeSoto's stock was the third-largest increase on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Review/Television; On the Bus With Jesse Jackson
description: ''Running With Jesse,'' tonight's offering on ''Frontline,'' is a reporter's-eye view of the Rev. Jesse Jackson as he sped around the country in his campaign for the Democratic Presidential nomination. Fueled by more determination than cash, the Jackson forces raced from town to town in what is described by one of the reporters in the back of the bus as ''a combination of hype and hope.''

title: Scripps-Howard Broadcasting Co reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss and included a $22 million writedown of intangible assets related to two independent television stations and a $9 million loss related to settlement of lawsuits. c-After a gain of $10 million from an accounting change.

title: Ryland Group Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Union Electric Co reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Steel Group Urges Shifts
description: An association of the largest customer group of the domestic steel industry called upon the Bush Administration today to make major modifications in steel import quotas when they expire later his year.

title: In Shopping, Prepare for the Worst
description: PITY the innocent customer who enters a computer store hoping to exchange large amounts of money for expert advice, courteous service and just the right hardware or software.

title: Midway Airlines Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a tax benefit of $174,000 and $2,599,000 for the quarter and year, respectively. c-Included a tax benefit of $1,956,000 and $7,550,000 for the quarter and year, respectively.

title: Chicago Board Sets Meeting
description: The Chicago Board of Trade has scheduled a meeting with its members on Thursday to discuss after-hours trading systems.

title: Officer Guilty in Marine Death
description: A court-martial jury today convicted a Marine sergeant of negligence in the death of a Marine who was left behind after a military exercise in the California desert last August.

title: No Showdown in Mile
description: The possibility of a mile showdown between Said Aouita and Marcus O'Sullivan was quashed when it was announced that the Moroccan would run 3,000 meters Friday night at the Vitalis Meadowlands Invitational.

title: New Challengers on Ice
description: Most of the skaters familiar a year ago are gone. The best of them, including Brian Boitano and Debi Thomas, are now touring professionals. In their absence, a new group will compete for titles at the national figure skating championships, which begin here Tuesday.

title: KEY RATES
Amax Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss c-Included income from discontinued operations of $8,300,000 and $2,300,000 for the quarter and year, respectively; losses on repurchases of debt of $4,100,000 for the quarter and $28,100,000 for the year, and the quarter also included a $107,800,000 reversal of a tax credit. Latest quarter and year included a $164,000,000 pre-tax gain on the sale of a 25 percent interest in two primary aluminum plants to a Japanese consortium. Latest year also included a $125,000,000 gain on an income tax settlement. Year-ago quarter and prior year results included $395,000,000 provision for the closure and restructuring of certain molybdenum assets. Year-ago quarter also included a $38,000,000 gain from the sale of oil and gas interests in the Dutch North Sea. Prior year included a $361,000,000 pretax gain from asset sales, the AGI public offering and pension plan settlements.

title: New York Acts To Alter Award Of Scholarships
description: Even before a Federal court found that New York State's method for awarding $40 million in college scholarships discriminated against girls, the State Education Department was prepared to revert to high school grades to determine who will receive awards this year, officials said today.

title: BankAmerica Payout: Signal of a Recovery
description: Reaching a significant milestone on its road to recovery, the BankAmerica Corporation announced today that it would pay a dividend on its common stock for the first time in three years.

title: SCIENCE WATCH;
description: SCIENTISTS at Sandia National Laboratories in Albuquerque, N.M., have invented a device costing less than $10 that would enable a car or missile to distinguish between a bump and a crash, and to react appropriately.

title: Hearings Sought for Sullivan
description: The White House asked Congress today to reschedule confirmation hearings for Dr. Louis W. Sullivan, the nominee for Health and Human Services Secretary, following his decision to give up nearly $300,000 in severance pay from his job as president of the Morehouse School of Medicine in Atlanta.

title: CONTEST PROMOTES ANTI-DRUG EFFORTS
description: A $26.4 million nationwide competition for programs to combat drug or alcohol abuse through preventive education and treatment was announced yesterday by the Robert Wood Johnson Foundation of Princeton, N.J.

title: The Ups and Downs of Spring Shoes
description: Changes are afoot in the world of footwear. This spring it is not enough simply to exchange black pumps for beige. There are new shapes, new heels, new materials and new colors.

title: Connecticut Energy Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Results for 1987 included a charge equal to 8 cents a share after-tax writedowns of the company's oil and gas operations.

title: Kentucky Sends Its Response
description: The University of Kentucky sent the National Collegiate Athletic Association today an eight-volume response to 18 allegations of wrongdoing.

title: Panel Finds No Evidence of Fraud in Report
description: A panel of the National Institutes of Health that has been investigating the accuracy of a notable research paper by a Nobel laureate, Dr. David Baltimore, says that ''no evidence was found of fraud, misconduct, manipulation of data or serious conceptual errors.''

title: Republic Bank 4-Year Notes
description: The Republic National Bank of New York offered $100 million worth of four-year notes yesterday through an underwriting syndicate led by Salomon Brothers.

title: Schult Homes reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss Year-ago and second-quarter results included a writeoff of $2.6 million for the closing of two plants and an increase in reserves for losses from the eventual resale of repossessed homes. Latest 6-month results included a tax benefit of $129,000. Share earnings are in units.

title: Casualty List A Long One
description: The list of casualties in the explosion of the Federal pay raise legislation on Capitol Hill today was lengthy.

title: The U.N. Today
description: Economic and Social Council STATISTICAL COMMISSION - 10 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: Aspen Music Festival Names New President
description: Robert Harth has been named president and chief executive officer of the Aspen Music Festival and School, effective Oct. 1. The announcement was made last week by Gordon Hardy, who has led the Colorado summer festival for 28 years.

title: Roll-Call Vote From the New York Area
description: Following are the positions of representatives from New York, New Jersey and Connecticut when the House today demanded a vote on a proposed 51 percent raise by rejecting a motion to adjourn. A ''yes'' vote is a vote to adjourn; ''xxx'' denotes those not voting. CONNECTICUT Democrats - Gejdenson, no; Kennelly, yes; Morrison, yes. Republicans - Johnson, no; Rowland, no; Shays, no. NEW JERSEY Democrats - Dwyer, xxx; Florio, no; Guarini, xxx; Hughes, no; Pallone, no; Payne, no; Roe, no; Torricelli, xxx. Republicans - Courter, no; Gallo, xxx; Rinaldo, no; Roukema, no; Saxton, no; Smith, no. NEW YORK Democrats - Ackerman, yes; Downey, yes; Engel, no; Flake, xxx; Garcia, xxx; Hochbrueckner, xxx; LaFalce, xxx; Lowey, no; Manton, xxx; McHugh, yes; McNulty, xxx; Mrazek, yes; Nowak, xxx; Owens, xxx; Rangel, yes; Scheuer, xxx; Schumer, xxx; Slaughter, xxx; Solarz, yes; Towns, xxx; Weiss, yes. Republicans - Boehlert, xxx; Fish, xxx; Gilman, no; Green, xxx; Horton, yes; Houghton, no; Lent, no; Martin, no; McGrath, no; Molinari, xxx; Paxon, xxx; Solomon, no; Walsh, no.

title: G.O.P. Fear: It's Now or Never on Tower Approval
description: Republicans on the Senate Armed Services Committee believe the nomination of John G. Tower as Secretary of Defense could become politically untenable if a vote is not taken by the committee this week, Senate Republicans and Congressional aides said today.

title: Bridge
description: Among the many misfortunes that bridge players encounter at the table, some are mercifully very rare. Most players will go through a lifetime of bridge without, for example, bidding to a major-suit game with a normal 8-card fit and then taking no trump tricks at all.

title: Pacific First Accepts Offer
description: The Pacific First Financial Corporation of Tacoma, Wash., the largest savings institution in the Pacific Northwest, agreed to be acquired by Royal Trustco Ltd. of Toronto for $27 a share in cash, or about $212 million.

title: Eastern Utilities Associates reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The company said earnings for the 1988 periods declined because of a deferral of a portion of the allowance for funds used during construction associated with the company's 15 percent ownership of the Seabrook, N.H. nuclear power plant.

title: BUSINESS DIGEST
description: The Economy

title: Ford, Suspecting Flaw, Delays Car Shipments
description: Concerned about potential quality problems in a line of recently introduced Ford Thunderbirds and Mercury Cougars, the Ford Motor Company put aside for inspection two weeks' production of vehicles near its assembly plant in Lorain, Ohio.

title: Diet Determines Color and Shape of a Caterpillar
description: The food eaten by a caterpillar in the Southwest causes bodily changes allowing the insect to mimic the seasonal appearance of its oak tree home, a researcher reports.

title: Europe Sets Rules on Chips
description: The European Community today introduced strict new rules affecting access to European markets for computer chips in a move that diplomats said could intensify United States and Japanese charges of protectionism.

title: Abitibi-Price Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a special gain of $2.9 million for both the quarter and year. Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: President's News Conference on Savings Crisis and Nominees
description: Following is a transcript of President Bush's part of a news conference in Washington yesterday as recorded by The New York Times through the facilities of ABC News: OPENING STATEMENT

title: Teahouse-Warming
description: When the Daimyo exhibition of Japanese art opened in the fall at the National Gallery of Art a Japanese newspaper, Asahi Shimbun, had an authentic teahouse built inside the museum at a cost of $700,000.

title: Somerset Group reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: b-Included net from discontinued operations of $1,607,000.

title: Along the Hudson, a Wrangle Over Water
description: The chemistry of the Hudson River swirls in complicated patterns that are not always understood even by scientists. But the lines in a debate over the proposed use of the river to supplement New York City's water supply are plainly drawn: the city vs. Poughkeepsie and several other communities along the Hudson for whom the river is the only source of drinking water.

title: Metro Datelines; Death of a Judge Is Ruled a Suicide
description: The state's Chief Medical Examiner ruled yesterday that the death of a Superior Court judge, Richard C. Noren, was a suicide. The judge killed himself, officials said, days after withdrawing his bid for reappointment while facing Judiciary Committee questions about his drinking.

title: 4 Killed in Manila Attack
description: Assassins believed to be Communist rebels killed a Philippine army major and his bodyguard today in a suburban Manila street attack that also left a bystander and one of the gunmen dead.

title: Davis and Balboni Win In Salary Arbitration
description: Glenn Davis and Steve Balboni won their salary arbitration cases yesterday, leaving players and owners tied at 2-2 in cases decided so far.

title: LTV Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a loss of $2,263,000,000 from an accounting change. c-Net income LTV said that in the third quarter of 1988 it changed its method of accounting for post-employment medical and life insurance benefits, effective Jan. 1, 1988, to a method which accrues these benefits over the period in which active employees become eligible for such post-employment benefits. It said the method it previously followed recognized these costs as they were incurred by retirees. The amounts in the 1987 periods have not been restated.

title: Arthur Zegart Is Dead; Writer of Film Was 72
description: Arthur Zegart, who was involved in the production of 125 documentaries, many of which he wrote and directed for network television, committed suicide Thursday by jumping off the Tappan Zee Bridge. Mr. Zegart, who had suffered for several years from a blood disease, was 72 years old and lived in Nyack, N.Y.

title: Insituform Gulf South reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income

title: Dresher Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a charge of $942,000 from a writedown of 50 percent of the carrying value of the company's loans and equity investment in Doxey Furniture Corp. c-Net income

title: Banco de Santander Sociedad Anonima de Credito reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The company attributed its gains in 1988 to a 31 percent growth in the gross interest margin, achieved through an 8.1 percent expansion of financial products, combined with a 4.5 percent reduction in financial costs.

title: Talley Is Selling Air Bag Business
description: Talley Industries said it had reached a definitive agreement to sell its automotive air bag business to TRW Inc. of Cleveland for $85 million in cash and other compensation. Talley, a diversified manufacturer of industrial and consumer products, said it would receive 12 years of royalty payments based on worldwide sales of air bags and also the return of intercompany debt.

title: Reviews/Dance; 'Ivesiana' Cast Changes
description: The New York City Ballet presented a dream of a program on Sunday afternoon at the New York State Theater. And two dancers stepping into roles in the ballets on that program were more than equal to the occasion.

title: Underlying Deadlock on Shoreham Is the Fear of Blame
description: Two months after lawmakers rejected a proposed deal to close the Shoreham nuclear power plant, negotiations to resolve the issue have foundered, victims of a tortuous political struggle between Gov. Mario M. Cuomo and the Legislature.

title: Corrections
description: Because of an editing error, an article on Sunday about the changing face of the AIDS epidemic misstated the rate of new AIDS diagnoses in gay men in recent years. As figures provided later in the same article indicate, somewhat above 7,000 new cases among gay men have been diagnosed every six months, not every year.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; Pro Bono
description: * Sudler & Hennessey has been named to create advertising for the National Hospice Organization, an Arlington, Va., organization devoted to support services for terminally ill people and their families.

title: Year of Snake Marks Decade of Change in Chinatown
description: Far from the firecrackers and lion dancers in Chinatown, Tu Hsiaochun and his wife began the Year of the Snake yesterday with an early morning bus trip from their home in Union City, N.J. to their tiny storefront restaurant on Second Avenue.

title: By Design: Fashionable Legs
description: Should your stockings or tights match the outfit you're wearing? Should they be in a contrasting color? Or is it once again highly stylish to slip into pantyhose the same shade as your skin?

title: Gathering in Honor of the Best Scenes of the '88 Season
description: The very last chapter of the 1988 racing season was written last Friday night when more than 1,000 improvers of the breed gathered in a ballroom of the Century Plaza Hotel for the 18th annual Eclipse Awards dinner.

title: Ex-Justice Powell Ill; Condition Is Stable In Florida Hospital
description: Lewis F. Powell Jr., retired Associate Justice of the United States Supreme Court, was admitted to a hospital today for treatment of an acute respiratory infection, a hospital spokeswoman said.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; Accounts
description: * Circus World, a toy-manufacturing division of Greenman Brothers, to Scott Lancaster Mills Atha, Los Angeles.

title: Lockheed Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 25
description: b-After income of $182 million from discontinued operations. c-After income of $1 million for the quarter and a loss of $6 million for the year, both from discontinued operations. The latest fourth quarter included charges of $15 million related to investments in high technology ventures and $20 million for ''uncertainties'' related to a contract settlement and other matters in Saudi Arabia. Operating adjustments, including a provision for anticipated cost increases on the C-17 wing production contract, also impacted results for the quarter.

title: U.S. Presses for Curbs on North Trial
description: The Justice Department today pressed the judge in the trial of Oliver L. North to issue rules that would let the Government block or censor portions of testimony that threaten the national security, said Bush Administration officials familiar with the case.

title: With Cloudy Crystal Balls, Scientists Race to Assess Global Warming
description: SPURRED by the anxiety of a public suddenly alert to the potential dangers of global warming, a small fraternity of scientists is running a high-stakes race against the environmental clock, trying to predict the precise impact of the greenhouse effect in time to take effective countermeasures.

title: Ron Field, a Tony Award Winner For His Choreography, Dies at 55
description: Ron Field, a Tony and Emmy Award-winning choreographer of Broadway musicals, died yesterday morning at St. Vincent's Hospital. He was 55 years old and lived in Manhattan. The cause of death was brain lesions and neurological impairments, said Mr. Field's lawyer, Michael Miller.

title: Prime Motor Inns Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Clippers Suspend Dailey
description: The Los Angeles Clippers, on the brink of equaling the franchise's record losing streak, suspended Quintin Dailey indefinitely for being overweight.

title: Study Clouds Suit on Nabisco Bonds
description: The Metropolitan Life Insurance Company, a bondholder that sued RJR Nabisco Inc. because its bonds lost value after Nabisco's management made a leveraged buyout offer, concluded in a confidential study that covenants with bondholders did not prevent RJR Nabisco from accepting such a bid, court documents filed last night show.

title: Service Fracturing Co reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income

title: A Political Philosopher Ruminates on Society And Its Contradictions
description: Standing like a moral guardian at the head of a celebrated chapter in ''The End of Ideology'' is this quote from Machiavelli: ''Men commit the error of not knowing when to limit their hopes.''

title: Philip B. Blank, Professor, 54
description: Philip B. Blank, an associate dean and professor at the Pace University School of Law in White Plains, died of congestive heart failure on Sunday at White Plains Hospital. He was 54 years old and lived in Valhalla, N.Y.

title: Regal-Beloit Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Our Peace Plan for El Salvador
description: In response to urgings from Vice-President Dan Quayle in his weekend visit to El Salvador, several political parties -including the ruling Christian Democrats - have agreed to reconsider a peace proposal by the guerrilla opposition. Thanks in part to this timely intervention from the Bush Administration, the proposal now seems to be creating the conditions for achieving peace in El Salvador.

title: Ondrej Nepela, Figure Skater, 38
description: Ondrej Nepela, the only Czechoslovak to have won an Olympic gold medal in figure skating, died in West Germany last Thursday, the West German Ice Skating Association announced. He was 38 years old and had been suffering from throat cancer.

title: New York and Jersey Told to Cut Water Use
description: A drought warning was issued yesterday by the Delaware River Basin Commission, which supplies New York City with about half its water. That is the second step in a drought alert process that began three weeks ago with a drought watch.

title: Ultimate Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 31
description: b-Included a gain of $2,000,000 from the cumulative effect of an accounting change. c-Net income The company said its cash position increased during the third quarter ended Jan. 31 to $19.3 million while its bank debt dropped to $15.5 million with payments of $4.5 million to its banks since the beginning of the fiscal year. The company also said trade receivables dropped to $66.3 million from $91.9 million at the beginning of the fiscal year, primarily due to improved collections. Company inventories were trimmed by 44 percent to $19.5 million from $35.1 million on the year's opening balance sheet.

title: Researchers Detect Evidence of a Virus In Sclerosis Patients
description: SCIENTISTS have found traces of viral genetic material in multiple sclerosis patients under circumstances that strengthen the long-standing suspicion that infection plays a role in the devastating disease.

title: Mexico Refuses U.S. Loan
description: A United States offer of a $3.5 billion emergency loan remains open, officials said today, even though Mexico has decided not to borrow the money and is trying to renegotiate payments on its crippling foreign debt.

title: Abrams Seeks To Restructure Child Societies
description: Most of a group of child-protection societies in New York State abuse their police powers and act as vigilantes or perform no function at all, the state's Attorney General said yesterday.

title: Corrections
description: A headline on Friday on an obituary of an oilman and philanthropist gave his first name incorrectly. He was Harold W. Siebens, not Howard W. Siebens.

title: FINANCE/NEW ISSUES;
description: The Student Loan Marketing Association, known as Sallie Mae, is offering $450 million of short-term floating-rate notes due Aug. 10, through various securities dealers.

title: Duquesne Light Co reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Consumers Gas Co reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Results are in Canadian dollars.

title: Manville Trust Fund In Trouble
description: The trust set up by the Manville Corporation to compensate victims of asbestos will run out of money later this year if settlements continue at their current rate, trust officials and other lawyers said yesterday.

title: Metro Datelines; Gun Bills Released By Assembly Panel
description: An Assembly panel yesterday released two bills that would stiffen the penalties for illegal firearms dealing, while a Senate committee withheld a vote on a bill to ban semi-automatic rifles that look like assault rifles after a large showing by National Rifle Association members.

title: Subway Fear Varying Little Since Attacks
description: The New York City subway system has been running for months now with a rapist on the loose. Yet fear seems to be no greater, and no less, than before.

title: A Top Officer Is Named At Revitalized Rohr
description: Rohr Industries, which has been turned around in the last few years since a decision to concentrate on aircraft and aerospace, said yesterday that it had named Robert H. Goldsmith president and chief operating officer.

title: BRIEFS
description: * Chicago Milwaukee Corp., Chicago, said it would hold a ''Dutch auction'' tender offer for up to 400,000 of its shares, with prices between $132.50 and $139.50 a share.

title: Lac Minerals Ltd reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a loss of $100,000 from discontinued operations for the quarter and year. c-After losses from discontinued operations of $1.4 million for the quarter and $3.2 million for the year. Some year-ago figures have been restated to reflect the company's discontinued oil and gas operations and interest in Stillwater Mining Co. The results are in Canadian dollars.

title: International Flavors & Frarances Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Tracking Vast Iceberg
description: An immense Antarctic iceberg that may have camps of Admiral Byrd and Roald Amundsen embedded in its core has zigzagged several hundred miles since it broke loose last October. It is now 177 miles from its starting point, the National Science Foundation reported. It is 95 miles long and 22 miles wide, almost as large as when it broke off, or calved, from the Ross Ice Shelf, the foundation said.

title: Barbara Tuchman Dead at 77; A Pulitzer-Winning Historian
description: Barbara W. Tuchman, whose skill at writing histories of men at war and on the brink of war won her two Pulitzer Prizes, died of complications of a stroke yesterday afternoon at Greenwich (Conn.) Hospital. She was 77 years old and was admitted to the hospital Saturday after suffering the stroke at her home at Cos Cob, Conn.

title: Illinois Central
description: The board of the Illinois Central Transportation Company said it would ''investigate alternatives'' to the $20-a-share tender offer from Prospect Group Inc. In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, the Illinois Central board also said it would remain neutral on Prospect's $434 million offer. Illinois Central's shares rose $1 today, to $22, on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: First Woman Is Appointed To Top Board at Harvard U.
description: For the first time in its 353-year history, Harvard University has elected a woman to serve on its highest governing board, the Harvard Corporation.

title:
THE MEDIA BUSINESS;
Time Inc. Finds New Ways To Profit on Swimsuit Issue
description: LEAD: Seeking to turn Sports Illustrated's annual swimsuit issue into even more of a cash machine, Time Inc. is marketing a videotape of the models in designer swimsuits, and its HBO cable service will carry a program on the making of the issue.

title: Salvador Offers Solutions, but Will We Listen?; The Military Route
description: To the Editor:

title: Donald W. Otto, 40, Public Radio Official
description: Donald W. Otto, the director of Eastern Public Radio since 1984, died of complications from acquired immune deficiency syndrome on Friday at his home in Long Island City, Queens. He was 40 years old.

title: Planning Dept. Wants What Others Seek of It
description: More light and air. That is what many New Yorkers have sought from the City Planning Department over the years. It turns out that the planners have been seeking the same things from the same source - the government of the City of New York.

title: Neoterik Health Technologies reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
description: The latest second quarter and 6 months' losses are after inventory writeoffs of $293,000.

title: The National Honeymoon With Cocaine Is Over, Again
description: THERE have been times when cocaine, now known to be dangerous and potentially life-threatening, has been regarded as a harmless way to enhance pleasure.

title: Airlease Ltd reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Share earnings represent units.

title: Gamesmanship Or Dirty Play?
description: Ask opponents if Bill Laimbeer of the Detroit Pistons gets under their skin, and you won't find much argument.

title: Biopharmaceutics reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included income from discontinued operations of $1,510. c-Net loss and after income from discontinued operations of $52,910. The company said share earnings for the latest quarter was less than one cent a share.

title: Corrections
description: An entry in the Company Briefs listing in Business Day on Jan. 28 about Cyclops Industries gave the company's status incorrectly. It was spun off by the Alleghany Corporation in 1987 and is independent.

title: New Solution Stretches Organ Transplant Time
description: A new chemical solution can preserve human livers outside the body for up to 34 hours, doctors have reported. This would more than triple the time surgeons have to get a donated organ into a dying patient.

title: Review/Pop; 2 Musical Romantics at Radio City
description: Johnny Mathis and Dionne Warwick, who have performed together frequently in recent years, may be the reigning exponents of a full-blown pop romanticism that seems more valuable the more it loses its commercial footing.

title: Jaguar Sales Up in U.S.
description: Jaguar Cars Inc., the United States subsidiary of Britain's Jaguar P.L.C., said today that its total sales for January were 1,492 units, up 28 percent from the 1,168 units sold a year earlier.

title: Facing the S & L's, Not So Squarely
description: President Bush has acted quickly to clean up the savings and loan mess; he's determined, he says, ''to face this problem squarely.'' But his contorted financing scheme needlessly raises the cost.

title: Kenan Transport Co reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a gain of $1.5 million from the cumulative effect of a change in accounting for income taxes.

title: Q&A
description: Q. How much warning could we expect of a comet or asteroid that would strike the Earth? Could we destroy or divert it? A. We would probably get only a few days' warning of a previously unknown object, such as an asteroid, probably not enough time to do anything to fend it off, astronomers believe, but such an object is likely to be fairly small. Very large comets are much less common, more likely to be detected, relatively easy to keep track of and much less likely to hit.

title: Heinrich W. Brinkmann, Mathematician, 90
description: Heinrich W. Brinkmann, a retired chairman of Swarthmore College's mathematics department, died of diabetes and old age Friday at his home in Swarthmore, Pa. He was 90 years old.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; Ad Revenues Up 8.65%
description: Magazine advertising revenues in 1988 increased 8.65 percent, to $5.94 billion, from a year earlier, the Publishers Information Bureau reported. The increase exceeded the 5.5 percent rise in 1987 and marked the largest annual gain since 1984. The greatest growth was in cosmetics and toiletries, which increased 21.5 percent, and in automobiles, which rose 17 percent.

title: ABQ Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income

title: Foundation Is to Assist Group of Soviet Dancers
description: Members of the Donetsk Ballet from the Soviet Union, whose planned tour is jeopardized because of lack of funds from their United States producers, are to receive living expenses for this week from a benefactor. The troupe made its United States debut in Baltimore on Thursday.

title: RUSSIANS GUARDING AIRPORT AT KABUL
description: The last Soviet military convoys rolled north from Kabul today, Soviet officials said, but hundreds of Soviet soldiers remained behind to guard the Afghan capital's airport, a lifeline for food and fuel made scarce by a blockade imposed by Muslim guerrillas.

title: Syracuse Holds Off Seton Hall To Win 20th
description: After building a 16-point lead against Seton Hall tonight, the Syracuse Orangemen almost fouled up. But Sherman Douglas wouldn't let them.

title: Turoff and Cab Owner Plead Guilty in Scheme for Extra Medallions
description: The former head of the New York City Taxi and Limousine Commission, Jay L. Turoff, and an owner of a large cab fleet, Donald Sherman, each pleaded guilty yesterday to participating in a scheme to misappropriate 23 taxicab medallions and more than $500,000 in taxicab revenues.

title: EW Scripps Co reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss c-After a gain of $14,131,000 from the cumulative effect of a change in accounting for income taxes. Latest fourth-quarter results included a net loss of $1.8 million on the expected sale this month of the Hollywood, Fla., Sun-Tattler. Latest-year results included a gain of $2.6 million, or 3 cents a share, from the sale of certain properties by 21 percent owned American City Business Journals. Year-ago fourth quarter results included a net loss of $11.2 million on the sales of certain properties and net charges totaling $28.2 million for the writedown of certain intangible assets, litigation and certain other items, and interest on the settlement of a federal tax audit. Prior-year results included a net gain of $13.3 million, or 18 cents a share, on the sale of certain properties.

title: William Forrest, Actor, 86
description: William Forrest, a former star athlete who appeared in nearly 200 films and on the television series ''The Adventures of Rin Tin Tin,'' died Jan. 29. He was 86 years old. Mr. Forrest's films included ''The Fighting Seabees,'' ''I'll See You in My Dreams,'' ''Here Comes Mr. Jordan,'' ''Miracle on 34th Street'' and ''They Died With Their Boots On.''

title: Bush Ethics Aide Quits Post in Family Company
description: C. Boyden Gray, President Bush's counsel and ethics adviser, resigned today as chairman of his family-owned $500 million communications company and will establish a blind trust to hold his personal assets, the White House said.

title: Irvine Sensors Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 1
description: Revenue represents contract revenue.

title: Police Vehicle Cards Going To Civilians Despite Curbs
description: Despite efforts by the New York City Police Department to reduce civilian use of police vehicle-identification cards, at least 37 civilians, including a teamster official, have continued to receive the treasured credentials.

title: Champion Spark Plug Gets Offer From Cooper Industries
description: A bidding war for the Champion Spark Plug Company, owner of one of the world's most familiar brand names, seemed likely today after Cooper Industries said it intended to offer at least $21 a share, of $735 million, for the company.

title: Big Sale Of Bonds
description: Pledging ''to restore our entire deposit insurance system to complete health,'' President Bush today announced a detailed plan to rescue the nation's savings and loan industry and bolster the banking industry with money collected from banks, savings and loan institutions and taxpayers.

title: Fed Forces Dollar Down Vs. Mark
description: A new round of concerted dollar selling by the Federal Reserve and European central banks forced the dollar lower against the mark yesterday.

title: Ingles Markets Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 24
THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; Addenda
description: * Meredith Corporation has announced the creation of Country America, a magazine to be published in association with the Nashville Network.

title: Salvador Offers Solutions, but Will We Listen?; Stop the Blood Money
description: To the Editor:

title: Pretoria Banker Discounts Sanctions
description: The head of South Africa's central bank said today that the nation was surviving the damage of Western economic sanctions despite a reduced annual growth rate and a heavy outflow of capital.

title: Better Drugs and Skills Prolonging Many Lives
description: It started as a hint, just a clinical impression that was hard to back up with statistics, but many doctors have recently become convinced that many of their AIDS patients are living longer than patients did a few years ago and surviving with a different spectrum of AIDS-related diseases. The clinical course of AIDS is changing, the doctors think.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; First Glimpse Of Murdoch's Mirabella
description: GRACE MIRABELLA, the former editor of Vogue, lifted the veil from her much-awaited new magazine late last week and revealed a cover without a woman on it.

title: The Real 'Eve' Sues to Film the Rest of Her Story
description: At the end of the 1957 film ''The Three Faces of Eve,'' which depicted the struggle of a young woman with multiple personality disorder, Eve, the title character, drives off with a new husband and her young daughter, presumably cured, to live happily ever after.

title: Profit Reported at Scripps
description: The E. W. Scripps Company said yesterday that its net income for the fourth quarter totaled $22.5 million, or 29 cents a share, compared with a loss of $18.6 million in the period a year earlier. Its revenues rose 6.1 percent, to $335.7 million from $316.3 million.

title: Andover Controls Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 8
Astronauts Drill For Emergency
description: Astronauts for the space shuttle Discovery ran through emergency drills at the launching pad today.

title: Iran Says Deal Freed Frenchmen
description: The Iranian Foreign Minister said today that France had reneged on a promise to free a murderer in return for the release of the last three French hostages in Lebanon.

title: Business and Health; Long-Term-Care Policies Improve
description: PRODDED by consumer groups, state regulators and Congressional proponents of a new Federal role in long-term care, many insurers have been making long-term-care policies more attractive to the elderly by lowering the barriers to receiving benefits.

title: George F. Zahn, Executive, 88
description: George F. Zahn, a retired maritime company executive, died Wednesday of lymphatic cancer at his home in Staten Island. He was 88 years old.

title: U.S. Cites Human Rights Abuses By Israel in Occupied Territories
description: In a report to be issued later this week, the United States says Israel's response to the Palestinian uprising ''led to a substantial increase in human rights violations'' in the West Bank and the Gaza Strip last year.

title: Outspoken and Impatient Scientist Takes Charge of War on Cancer
description: Dr. Samuel Broder, a man of intensity and impatience, believes that the National Cancer Institute is a place where people with ambition, energy and fresh ideas can step forward and take charge.

title: Patterns
description: Bridal Dresses From Asia

title: Slaying Suspect to Get Gene Tests
description: The man accused of raping and killing a doctor at Bellevue Hospital Center last month agreed to submit to genetic testing after pleading not guilty yesterday at his arraignment in State Supreme Court in Manhattan.

title: Memphis Journal; New Dream From an Old Nightmare
description: In a forlorn neighborhood here on the fringes of downtown stands a boarded-up motel, its sign now just darkened curlicues of empty glass tubing that once crackled and glowed with the neon announcement that this was the Lorraine Motel.

title: Prisoner At the Window
description: The commandant at the Soviet prison camp in the Urals said that unfortunately some of the prisoners we wanted to talk to had suddenly come down with the grippe and were in the hospital ward. No visitors allowed; he would not budge.

title: The Man Who Brings Pie in the Sky to Earth
description: Representative Dan Rostenkowski, chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, was grumbling about the pie-in-the-sky people, the people who do not know how to compromise.

title: Arnold Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
California Energy Co reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The company changed its fiscal year-end from Jan. 31 to Dec. 31 in 1987. The company said that for the two months ended Dec. 31, 1987, it had a loss of $518,000 on $2,072,000 in revenue. For the 11 months ended Dec. 31, 1987, it had a loss of $386,000 on revenue of $3,849,000.

title: Kitty Dukakis Being Treated For a Problem With Drinking
description: Kitty Dukakis, the wife of Gov. Michael S. Dukakis of Massachusetts, is being treated for alcohol abuse at a clinic in Newport, R.I., the Governor said today.

title: A Star of the Circus Is Turning In His Wrip
description: The Greatest Show on Earth has never been given to understatement about itself. But even by the venerable and generous standards of circus bombast, the Farewell Tour of Gunther Gebel-Williams is attaining new levels of hyperbole.

title: Lawyers Reject Anti-Gay Bias
description: The nation's largest organization of lawyers, the American Bar Association, today went on record in favor of legislation to bar discrimination against homosexuals.

title: Havana Journal; On Castro's Ship of State, Is the Ideology Leaking?
description: The rock music at the youth center was blaring, and the boys huddled off to one side had to lean close to hear one another talk. They didn't actually like the music, they said, but there was nothing else to do, nowhere else to go.

title: Salvador Offers Solutions, but Will We Listen?; Nicaraguan Economy
description: To the Editor:

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''I think it's time to acknowledge the will of the House. It is apparent to me that a majority of the members desire to have a vote up or down, and we will have that vote tomorrow.'' - House Speaker Jim Wright. [ A1:6. ]

title: Lower Net Is Posted at LTV
description: The LTV Corporation, taking a number of one-time charges to complete a restructuring, posted a fourth-quarter net income of $95.3 million, or 77 cents a share, on sales of $1.67 billion. In the corresponding quarter a year ago, LTV earned $140.6 million, or $1.17 a share, on sales of $1.98 billion.

title: Donald Harry Cowles, Retired General, 71
description: Liet. Gen. Donald Harry Cowles, retired, an Army deputy chief of staff in the mid-1970's, died Saturday at Alexandria Hospital. He was 71 years old.

title: Patrick Industries reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Latest-year results included a $126,000 gain from an accounting change.

title: Books of The Times; Stories That Call an Evil by Its Name
description: Most contemporary fiction trades in ambiguities, the grays and pastels of emotion and morality. In Ron Hansen's beautifully crafted stories, however, wickedness, evil, malice is called by name; and for his people, the snake in the garden never fails to appear. As one character puts it: ''You pay your bills, you try and live simple, you pray to the Lord for guidance, but Satan can still find a loophole, can't he? He'll trip you up every time.''

title: Gretzky Gets Ready for a Reunion of Sorts
description: The celebrated photograph, splashed across newspapers here over the weekend, was a formal and handsome portrait of Wayne Gretzky with his wife and infant daughter. No doubt it charmed the people of this city, who still ache for their lost hero.

title: Tauscher Edges Swiss For Men's Downhill Title
description: The cowbells and drumbeats were briefly silenced today when Hansjoerg Tauscher of West Germany crossed the finish line of the men's downhill race in the world Alpine championships.

title: Transactions
description: Baseball

title: Wellco Enterprises Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
For Many, Turmoil of Aging Erupts in the 50's, Studies Find
description: WHILE any number of people anguish over their 30th birthday and try to hide their 40th, it is with the 50th that most start to actually see themselves as beginning to be old, researchers are finding.

title: Two Budget Tales of Prudence and Pain; The Deficit Doesn't Justify Cheating Schools
description: Governor Cuomo's new budget would impose new unfairness on top of that already inflicted by the state on New York City schools.

title: Costa Rica Struggles With Enigma: Is Local Hero Also a U.S. Warlord?
description: Ask about John Hull around here and you will get a dozen stories, all of them extreme.

title: Kustom Electronics Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Dow, in 4th Straight Pullback, Falls 10.18
description: LEAD: Takeover stories dominated a subdued Wall Street yesterday as blue-chip stocks sold off again.

title: John Tries To Find Out If Yanks Want Him
description: Memo to the office: Tommy John is willing.

title: Legacy of Mao Called 'Great Disaster'
description: In one of the harshest official appraisals so far of Mao Zedong, a leading Chinese newspaper has said he brought great disasters to the Chinese people.

title: Intermet Corp reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Deft Politics, Fiscal Doubt
description: The Bush Administration's rescue plan for the savings industry appears to be a politically deft approach that is likely to find broad support in Congress. But the plan's economic underpinnings may stand on shaky ground.

title: At the Wordsmithy
description: President Bush is trying a rather novel experiment with his speechwriting team: no chief and, at present, only two Indians.

title: Treasury Prices Are Off Slightly
description: Prices of Treasury bonds and notes dipped slightly in listless trading yesterday, as market participants prepared for the start of the Treasury's quarterly refunding auctions today and watched the Federal Reserve Board for clues about whether the central bank has tightened credit conditions again.

title: 2 Issues by Unit Of British Telecom
description: British Telecom Finance yesterday offered two debt issues through a syndicate led by Goldman, Sachs & Company.

title: Scientists Studying the Drug Ecstasy Decipher Its Destructive Secrets
description: WITH widening use of the illicit drug known as ecstasy, researchers have been scrambling to learn whether it can cause serious, or even permanent, damage to the brain.

title: Constar International Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included net from discontinued operations of $4,235,000 and $2,233,000 for the quarter and year, respectively. c-After a loss of $202,000 for the quarter and net of $385,000 for the year, both from discontinued operations.

title: Preston Corp() reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss

title: SSMC Attracts New Suitors
description: Two separate investment groups emerged today to challenge a friendly $163 million tender offer for SSMC Inc. by a Hong Kong concern. One group is led by Paul A. Bilzerian, the chairman of the Singer Company, which spun off SSMC as an independent company in 1986. Singer retained a 27 percent stake in SSMC, which makes Singer sewing machines. The other is led by Vincent

title: Teradyne Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The latest quarter included a pre- tax restructuring charge of $16,013,000. The year-ago quarter included a pre-tax charge of $10,455,000 from product line restructuring and merger and consolidation expenses.

title: THE MEDIA BUSINESS: Advertising; Popular Science
description: Popular Science magazine wants it known that more than one magazine is remodeling a house with advertisers' products. The March, April and May issues of the Times Mirror Magazines publication will carry a series of special advertising sections under the heading ''Home Remodeling Guide'' that show a residence being gutted and then renovated with the products of 44 advertisers. More than 100 ad pages have been sold. Several weeks ago, Family Circle magazine announced a joint promotion with the K Mart Corporation that would involve editorial and advertising coverage of a home renovation.

title: Alloy Computer Products Inc reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included tax credits of $315,000. c-Net loss d-Net income The company said the latest quarter included charges associated with the company's 7 percent reduction in its domestic work force; the company didn't specify the amount of the charges.

title: R P Scherer reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Included a tax credit of $932,000. c-Included a tax credit of $158,000 and $398,000 for the quarter and 9 months, respectively. d-Net income Results for the latest third quarter included non-recurring charges totaling $6.9 million. The charges included severance pay for the company's former president and its chief financial officer, both of whom resigned during the quarter, and other unusual expenses relating to the sale process in which the company is currently involved. The company also said it made provisions in the quarter for $842,000 in charges related to an idle facility in New Jersey.

title: Praise on Capitol Hill For Rescue Proposal
description: Congressional leaders today expressed general approval of the Bush Administration's plan to resolve the savings and loan crisis. And the industry's principal trade association said it was neither endorsing nor rejecting the proposal.

title: Metro Datelines; Columbia Appoints Medical School Dean
description: The chairman of psychiatry at Columbia University's medical school has been named Dean of the Faculty of Medicine and Vice President for Health Sciences by the university, its president, Michael I. Sovern, announced today.

title: Yugoslav Snaps Schneider's Streak
description: There was a smile from Vreni Schneider after the first 15 racers had completed their runs, but it was the slightly disappointed smile of a good sport. The Swiss racer's streak was broken.

title: At the Nation's Table
